parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

object.name: Device.Ethernet.VLANTermination.{i}.
object.description: VLAN Termination table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). A VLAN Termination entry is typically stacked on top of a {{object|#.Link}} object to receive and send frames with the configured {{param|VLANID}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the VLANTermination entry. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the VLANTermination entry (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the VLANTermination entry as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the VLANTermination entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.

parameter.name: VLANID
parameter.description: The VLAN ID for this {{object}} entry (as defined in {{bibref|802.1Q-2011}}). Only ingress frames with this VLAN ID will be passed to higher protocol layers; frames sent from higher protocol layers will be tagged with this VLAN ID.

parameter.name: TPID
parameter.description: The Tag Protocol Identifier (TPID) assigned to this {{object}}. The TPID is an EtherType value used to identify the frame as a tagged frame. Standard {{bibref|802.1Q-2011|Table 9.1}} TPID values are: *S-TAG 0x88A8 = 34984 *C-TAG 0x8100 = 33024 Non-Standard TPID values are: *S-TAG 0x9100 = 37120

object.name: Device.Ethernet.VLANTermination.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

object.name: Device.Ethernet.RMONStats.{i}.
object.description: Ethernet statistics based on the {{bibref|RFC2819}} ''RMON-MIB'' ''etherStatsTable'', with some extensions inspired by {{bibref|G.988|Section 9.3.32}}. Each instance is associated with an interface capable of transporting Ethernet-encapsulated packets, and contains a set of unidirectional Ethernet statistics. The statistics are sampled either on ingress or on egress. This is determined as follows: * If the instance is associated with an egress queue (or queues) via the {{param|Queue}} parameter or by setting {{param|AllQueues}} to {{true}} then data is sampled on egress. In this case {{param|Bytes}} etc measure the data that has been sent on the interface, possibly filtered by {{param|Queue}} or {{param|VLANID}}. * Otherwise data is sampled on ingress. In this case {{param|Bytes}} etc measure the data that has been received on the interface, possibly filtered by {{param|VLANID}}. When sampling on egress, the term ''received'' means ''received by the queuing sub-system''. Multiple instances can be associated with a single interface: individual instances can be configured to collect data associated with the entire interface, or with a particular VLAN and/or queue. The CPE MUST reset each instances's Stats parameters whenever the instance is disabled and re-enabled. Whether this reset occurs when the instance becomes operationally disabled ({{param|Status}} = {{enum|Disabled|Status}}) or administratively enabled ({{param|Enable}} = {{true}}) is a local matter to the CPE. This is similar to the behavior of interface statistics, e.g. as specified for {{object|Device.Ethernet.Interface.{i}.Stats}}. Furthermore, this instance's Stats parameters MUST be reset whenever the referenced interface's Stats parameters are reset, or when the referenced queue or VLAN is disabled and re-enabled. For enabled table entries, if {{param|Interface}} references an interface that is not capable of transporting Ethernet-encapsulated packets, or if {{param|Queue}} references a queue that is not instantiated on {{param|Interface}}, or if {{param|Queue}} is not a valid reference and {{param|AllQueues}} is {{false}}, the table entry is inoperable and the CPE MUST set {{param|Status}} to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|Status}}. Note: The {{object}} table includes unique key parameters that are strong references. If a strongly referenced object is deleted, the CPE will set the referencing parameter to {{empty}}. However, doing so under these circumstances might cause the updated {{object}} row to then violate the table's unique key constraint; if this occurs, the CPE MUST set {{param|Status}} to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|Status}} and disable the offending {{object}} row.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this instance.

parameter.name: Status
Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the {{object}} entry as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: The interface associated with this instance. {{reference|an interface that is capable of transporting Ethernet-encapsulated packets}} The term "capable of transporting Ethernet-encapsulated packets" means "has an Ethernet header" and therefore refers to any interface that is at or below an ''Ethernet''.{{object|#.Link}} instance in the interface stack.

parameter.name: VLANID
parameter.description: Filter criterion. The VLAN ID for which statistics are to be collected. A zero value indicates that all packets, whether or not they have a VLAN header, will be considered. A non-zero value indicates that only packets that have the the specified VLAN ID will be considered.

parameter.name: Queue
parameter.description: Filter criterion. The egress queue with which this instance is associated. Only packets that are sent to the referenced queue will be considered.

parameter.name: AllQueues
parameter.description: Indicates whether this instance applies to all queues. If {{true}}, the value of {{param|Queue}} is ignored since all egress queues are indicated.

parameter.name: DropEvents
parameter.description: The total number of events in which packets were dropped due to lack of resources. Note that this number is not necessarily the number of packets dropped; it is just the number of times this condition has been detected. This parameter is based on ''etherStatsDropEvents'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: Bytes
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} (including those in bad packets) received (excluding framing bits but including FCS bytes). This parameter is based on ''etherStatsOctets'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: Packets
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} (including bad packets, broadcast packets, and multicast packets) received. This parameter is based on ''etherStatsPkts'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: BroadcastPackets
parameter.description: The total number of good {{units}} received that were directed to the broadcast address. Note that this does not include multicast packets. This parameter is based on ''etherStatsBroadcastPkts'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: MulticastPackets
parameter.description: The total number of good {{units}} received that were directed to a multicast address. Note that this number does not include packets directed to the broadcast address. This parameter is based on ''etherStatsMulticastPkts'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: CRCErroredPackets
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received that had a length (excluding framing bits, but including FCS bytes) of between 64 and 1518 bytes, inclusive, but had either a bad Frame Check Sequence (FCS) with an integral number of bytes (FCS Error) or a bad FCS with a non-integral number of bytes (Alignment Error). This parameter is based on ''etherStatsCRCAlignErrors'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: UndersizePackets
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received that were less than 64 bytes long (excluding framing bits, but including FCS bytes) and were otherwise well formed. This parameter is based on ''etherStatsUndersizePkts'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: OversizePackets
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received that were longer than 1518 bytes (excluding framing bits, but including FCS bytes) and were otherwise well formed. This parameter is based on ''etherStatsOversizePkts'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: Packets64Bytes
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} (including bad packets) received that were 64 bytes in length (excluding framing bits but including FCS bytes). This parameter is based on ''etherStatsPkts64Octets'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: Packets65to127Bytes
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} (including bad packets) received that were between 65 and 127 bytes in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS bytes). This parameter is based on ''etherStatsPkts65to127Octets'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: Packets128to255Bytes
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} (including bad packets) received that were between 128 and 255 bytes in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS bytes). This parameter is based on ''etherStatsPkts6128to255Octets'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: Packets256to511Bytes
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} (including bad packets) received that were between 256 and 511 bytes in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS bytes). This parameter is based on ''etherStatsPkts256to511Octets'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: Packets512to1023Bytes
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} (including bad packets) received that were between 512 and 1023 bytes in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS bytes). This parameter is based on ''etherStatsPkts512to1023Octets'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

parameter.name: Packets1024to1518Bytes
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} (including bad packets) received that were between 1024 and 1518 bytes in length inclusive (excluding framing bits but including FCS bytes). This parameter is based on ''etherStatsPkts1024to1518Octets'' from {{bibref|RFC2819}}.

object.name: Device.Ethernet.LAG.{i}.
object.description: Ethernet Link Aggregation Group (LAG) table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). Table entries model the Link Aggregation Sub-Layer as defined in {{bibref|802.3-2015}} and {{bibref|802.1AX-2014}}. It is expected that a {{object}} interface can only be stacked above {{object|.Ethernet.Interface}} interfaces. The CPE can reject creation of additional LAG instances if this would exceed its capabilities.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the interface. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the LAG interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}}. See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}. {{param}} must reference to Device.Ethernet.Interface instances where Link Aggregation Group is configured by the CPE. For example, "Device.Ethernet.Interface.1, Device.Ethernet.Interface.2"

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of the Link Aggregation Interface.

object.name: Device.Ethernet.LAG.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived

parameter.name: PacketsSent

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

object.name: Device.USB.
object.description: Universal Serial Bus ({{bibref|USB1.0}}, {{bibref|USB2.0}}, {{bibref|USB3.0}}). This object contains the {{object|Interface}}, {{object|Port}}, and {{object|USBHosts}} objects.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: PortNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.USB.Interface.{i}.
object.description: USB interface table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). This table models master and slave USB physical interfaces that support carrying Ethernet frames, e.g. via the USB Communication Device Class.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the interface. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}. Note: Since {{object}} is a layer 1 interface, it is expected that {{param}} will not be used.

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}). For example: * For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces. * For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface. * For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the interface. Note: This is not necessarily the same as the Ethernet header source or destination MAC address, which is associated with the IP interface and is modeled via the {{param|.Ethernet.Link.{i}.MACAddress}} parameter.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum PHY bit rate supported by this interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: {{reference}} This is the USB port associated with this interface object.

object.name: Device.USB.Interface.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent

object.name: Device.USB.Port.{i}.
object.description: USB Port table. This table models master and slave USB physical ports on the device.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the port.

parameter.name: Standard
parameter.description: USB specification version supported by the Port. Example: "1.1"

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Type of the USB connection.

parameter.name: Receptacle
parameter.description: Receptacle of the port.

parameter.name: Rate
parameter.description: Current speed of the USB connection. {{enum}}

parameter.name: Power
parameter.description: Power configuration of the USB connection. {{enum}} Only applies when {{param|Type}} is {{enum|Device|Type}}. In other cases value is {{enum|Unknown}}.

object.name: Device.USB.USBHosts.
object.description: This object models the CPE's USB Host controllers. See {{bibref|TR-157|Appendix I}} for Theory of Operation.

parameter.name: HostNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.USB.USBHosts.Host.{i}.
object.description: Table of CPE USB Host controllers.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the USB Host controller.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: User-readable host controller name.

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Type of USB Host

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, reset the Host Controller and apply the reset signaling (see {{bibref|USB2.0|Chapter 7.1.7.5}}) to all of the Host Controller Hub downstream ports. The value is not saved in the device's state and setting it to {{false}} has no effect.

parameter.name: PowerManagementEnable
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, {{param}} enables the Host Controller to invoke Power Management policy, i.e. controlled Suspend (see {{bibref|USB2.0}}, Chapters 4.3.2, 7.1.7.6, and 11.9). When set to {{false}} {{param}} immediately disables the Host controller Power Management policy.

parameter.name: USBVersion
parameter.description: USB specification version with which the controller complies. Example: "1.1"

parameter.name: DeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.USB.USBHosts.Host.{i}.Device.{i}.
object.description: Table of connected USB devices.

parameter.name: DeviceNumber
parameter.description: Device number on USB bus.

parameter.name: USBVersion
parameter.description: USB specification version with which the device complies. Example: "1.1"

parameter.name: DeviceClass
parameter.description: Class Code as assigned by USB-IF. When 0x00, each device specifies its own class code. When 0xFF, the class code is vendor specified.

parameter.name: DeviceSubClass
parameter.description: Subclass code (assigned by USB-IF).

parameter.name: DeviceVersion
parameter.description: Device release number.

parameter.name: DeviceProtocol
parameter.description: Protocol code (assigned by USB-IF).

parameter.name: ProductID
parameter.description: Product ID (assigned by manufacturer).

parameter.name: VendorID
parameter.description: Vendor ID (assigned by USB-IF).

parameter.name: Manufacturer
parameter.description: Device Manufacturer string descriptor.

parameter.name: ProductClass
parameter.description: Device Product Class string descriptor.

parameter.name: SerialNumber
parameter.description: Device SerialNumber string descriptor.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: Hub port on parent device. 0 when no parent.

parameter.name: USBPort
parameter.description: {{reference}} This is a reference to the USB host device to which this (external) USB device is connected.

parameter.name: Rate
parameter.description: Speed of the USB device. {{enum}} Internal signaling between the connected USB device and the USB Host Controller provide the information needed to determine the negotiated rate.

parameter.name: Parent
parameter.description: {{reference}} This is a reference to the parent USB device (e.g. hub device). This is {{empty}} for a device connected to the Host controller (root hub).

parameter.name: MaxChildren
parameter.description: Number of ports. Only applies for hub device, equal to 0 for other devices.

parameter.name: IsSuspended
parameter.description: When {{true}} the associated Device is in a suspended (i.e. low-power) state (see {{bibref|USB2.0|Chapter 11.9}}). When {{false}} the associated Device is in any of the other states specified by the USB 2.0 Device State Machine (see {{bibref|USB2.0|Chapter 9.1.1}}).

parameter.name: IsSelfPowered
parameter.description: When {{true}} the associated device is at least partly powered by a local source (see {{bibref|USB2.0|Chapter 9.4.5}}). When {{false}} the associated device draws all the current it needs from the USB bus.

parameter.name: ConfigurationNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.USB.USBHosts.Host.{i}.Device.{i}.Configuration.{i}.
object.description: Table of device configurations.

parameter.name: ConfigurationNumber
parameter.description: The identifier for each Device Configuration.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.USB.USBHosts.Host.{i}.Device.{i}.Configuration.{i}.Interface.{i}.
object.description: Table of device interface descriptors.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumber
parameter.description: Number of this interface (from USB interface descriptor).

parameter.name: InterfaceClass
parameter.description: Class Code as assigned by USB-IF. When 0x00, each interface specifies its own class code. When 0xFF, the class code is vendor specified.

parameter.name: InterfaceSubClass
parameter.description: Subclass code (assigned by USB-IF).

parameter.name: InterfaceProtocol
parameter.description: Protocol code (assigned by USB-IF).

object.name: Device.HPNA.
object.description: HPNA object that contains the {{object|Interface}} and {{object|Diagnostics}} objects. The HPNA (also known as HomePNA) industry standard {{bibref|G.9954}} defines peer to peer communication for home networking over existing coax cables and telephone wiring within the home.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.HPNA.Interface.{i}.
object.description: HPNA interface table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). Each table entry models the PHY and MAC levels of an HPNA interface {{bibref|G.9954}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the interface. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}. Note: Since {{object}} is a layer 1 interface, it is expected that {{param}} will not be used.

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}). For example: * For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces. * For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface. * For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the interface. Note: This is not necessarily the same as the Ethernet header source or destination MAC address, which is associated with the IP interface and is modeled via the {{param|.Ethernet.Link.{i}.MACAddress}} parameter.

parameter.name: FirmwareVersion
parameter.description: This interface's firmware version.

parameter.name: NodeID
parameter.description: The Node ID of this interface.

parameter.name: IsMaster
parameter.description: Whether this interface is the HPNA network master.

parameter.name: Synced
parameter.description: Whether this interface is synchronized with the HPNA network master. If this interface is the HPNA network master, {{param}} MUST be {{true}}.

parameter.name: TotalSyncTime
parameter.description: Total time in {{units}} (since device reset) that this interface has been up and synchronized to the HPNA network master.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum HPNA PHY bit rate (expressed in {{units}}) of this interface.

parameter.name: NetworkUtilization
parameter.description: Current HPNA network utilization (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: PossibleConnectionTypes
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate the types of connections possible for this interface. {{enum}}

parameter.name: ConnectionType
parameter.description: {{list}} Connection type(s) for which the HPNA protocol is active.

parameter.name: PossibleSpectralModes
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate the spectral modes possible for this interface. {{enum}}

parameter.name: SpectralMode
parameter.description: Spectral mode for which the HPNA protocol is active.

parameter.name: MTU
parameter.description: Maximum Transmission Unit for this HPNA interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: NoiseMargin
parameter.description: The desired noise margin for which the local HPNA interface has been configured (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: DefaultNonLARQPER
parameter.description: The desired packet error rate for which the local HPNA interface has been configured (expressed in 1E-8, e.g. PER of 1.27E-6 will be presented as 127).

parameter.name: LARQEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable the Limited Automatic Repeat Request (LARQ) mechanism.

parameter.name: MinMulticastRate
parameter.description: The minimum multicast (and broadcast) rate that can be negotiated on the HPNA network directly accessible via this interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: NegMulticastRate
parameter.description: The negotiated multicast (and broadcast) rate on the HPNA network directly accessible via this interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: MasterSelectionMode
parameter.description: Master selection mode. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Force local HPNA interface to be end point
Force local HPNA interface to be master

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}} This is the number of HPNA nodes that are directly accessible via this interface.

object.name: Device.HPNA.Interface.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

object.name: Device.HPNA.Interface.{i}.QoS.
object.description: QoS configuration object.

parameter.name: FlowSpecNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.HPNA.Interface.{i}.QoS.FlowSpec.{i}.
object.description: Flow specification table. The {{object|.QoS.Classification}} table is used to classify ingress traffic, where {{param|.QoS.Classification.{i}.TrafficClass}} is one of the classification result outputs. This ''TrafficClass'' value can be used to look up the appropriate {{object}} entry (i.e. the {{object}} entry whose {{param|TrafficClasses}} list contains a matching traffic class). For enabled table entries, if {{param|TrafficClasses}} is {{empty}} then the table entry is inoperable and the CPE MUST set {{param|Status}} to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|Status}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the table entry.

parameter.name: Status
Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: TrafficClasses
parameter.description: {{list}} This list identifies the set of traffic classes associated with this flow spec.

parameter.name: FlowType
parameter.description: Flow type. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Variable Bit Rate - Non Real Time

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.description: Flow queue network priority. Priority 0 is the lowest priority.

parameter.name: Latency
parameter.description: Maximum latency of the flow (expressed in {{units}}). Value 0 means no latency requirements.

parameter.name: Jitter
parameter.description: Maximum jitter of the flow (expressed in {{units}}). Value 0 means no jitter requirements.

parameter.name: PacketSize
parameter.description: Typical packet size. Value 0 means undefined packet size.

parameter.name: MinRate
parameter.description: Minimum required rate in Kbps. Value 0 means no MinRate requirements.

parameter.name: AvgRate
parameter.description: Average required rate in Kbps. Value 0 means no AvgRate requirements.

parameter.name: MaxRate
parameter.description: Maximum required rate in Kbps. Value 0 means no MaxRate requirements.

parameter.name: PER
parameter.description: The desired packet error rate (expressed in 1E-8, e.g. PER of 1.27E-6 will be presented as 127). Value 0 means no PER requirements.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: Flow inactivity tear down timeout (expressed in {{units}}). Value 0 means unlimited timeout.

object.name: Device.HPNA.Interface.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.
object.description: This table provides information about other HPNA devices that are directly accessible via this HPNA interface.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of this node.

parameter.name: NodeID
parameter.description: The Node ID of this node.

parameter.name: IsMaster
parameter.description: Whether this node is the HPNA network master.

parameter.name: Synced
parameter.description: Whether this node is synchronized with the HPNA network master. If this node is the HPNA network master, {{param}} MUST be {{true}}.

parameter.name: TotalSyncTime
parameter.description: Total time in {{units}} (since device reset) that this node has been up and synchronized to the HPNA network master.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: This node's maximum HPNA PHY bit rate (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: PHYDiagnosticsEnable
parameter.description: Enable / disable PHY throughput diagnostics mode on this node. All devices that are enabled will participate in the HPNA network PHY throughput diagnostics process.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.description: Whether or not this node is currently present in the HPNA network. The ability to list inactive nodes is OPTIONAL. If the CPE includes inactive nodes in this table, {{param}} MUST be set to {{false}} for each inactive node. The length of time an inactive node remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

object.name: Device.HPNA.Diagnostics.
object.description: The HPNA Diagnostics object.

object.name: Device.HPNA.Diagnostics.PHYThroughput.
object.description: HPNA PHY throughput diagnostics configuration and results. When diagnostics are requested, all HPNA nodes for which the {{param|##.Interface.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.PHYDiagnosticsEnable}} parameter is set enter PHY diagnostics mode.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: {{reference}} This is the interface over which the test is to be performed.

parameter.name: NumPacketsInBurst
parameter.description: Number of test packet in burst to be send during PHY diagnostics test from each HPNA device to other HPNA device in the HPNA network.

parameter.name: BurstInterval
parameter.description: Test packet burst interval length (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: TestPacketPayloadLength
parameter.description: Payload length in the test packets.

parameter.name: PayloadEncoding
parameter.description: HPNA payload encoding in PHY diagnostics. 0 is used for negotiated payload between devices according to line conditions.

parameter.name: PayloadDataGen
parameter.description: Test packets payload data generator value.

parameter.name: PayloadType
PriorityLevel
parameter.description: Priority level of PHY diagnostics packets (0 lowest -7 highest).

parameter.name: ResultNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}} This is the number of PHY diagnostics results.

object.name: Device.HPNA.Diagnostics.PHYThroughput.Result.{i}.
object.description: PHY throughput diagnostics results. Each result object corresponds to unidirectional traffic between two PHY diagnostics-enabled nodes (so there are two such objects for each such pair).

parameter.name: SrcMACAddress
parameter.description: HPNA source MAC address.

parameter.name: DestMACAddress
parameter.description: HPNA destination MAC address.

parameter.name: PHYRate
parameter.description: PHY diagnostics HPNA PHY rate (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: BaudRate
parameter.description: PHY Baud rate (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: SNR
parameter.description: PHY diagnostics SNR (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Number of received packets in PHY diagnostics mode.

parameter.name: Attenuation
parameter.description: Measured attenuation (expressed in {{units}}).

object.name: Device.HPNA.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.
object.description: HPNA performance monitoring configuration and results. Performance monitoring results are sampled from all nodes in the HPNA network. All packet related counters are sampled synchronized at all nodes in the HPNA network in order to derive packet loss calculations in the HPNA network.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: {{reference}} This is the interface over which the test is to be performed.

parameter.name: SampleInterval
parameter.description: Time in {{units}} between automatic collection of performance monitoring data. A value of zero disables automatic collection of data. The CPE MAY impose a minimum sample interval, in which case an attempt to set a (non-zero) interval that is less than this minimum MUST set the interval to the minimum and MUST NOT be regarded as an error. If SampleInterval is a simple fraction of a day, e.g. 900 (a quarter of an hour) or 3600 (an hour), the CPE MAY choose to align sample intervals with time of day, but is not required to do so.

object.name: Device.HPNA.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.Nodes.
object.description: Per-node HPNA performance monitoring results. When automatic collection is enabled, i.e. {{param|#.SampleInterval}} is non-zero, the "current" interval is defined by the most recent automatic sample and the most recent subsequent manual sample, if any. When automatic collection is disabled, i.e. SampleInterval is zero, the "current" interval is defined by the three most recent manual samples. Note: Packets in statistics counters are Ethernet packets.

parameter.name: CurrentStart
parameter.description: Start time for the current interval. When automatic collection is enabled, i.e. SampleInterval is non-zero, the current interval started at the most recent automatic sample. When automatic collection is disabled, i.e. SampleInterval is zero, the current interval started two manual samples ago.

parameter.name: CurrentEnd
parameter.description: End time for the current interval. When automatic collection is enabled, i.e. SampleInterval is non-zero, the current interval ended at the most recent manual sample since the most recent automatic sample. If there has been no such manual sample, the current interval is empty. When automatic collection is disabled, i.e. SampleInterval is zero, the current interval ended at the most recent manual sample.

parameter.name: NodeNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}} This is the number of HPNA nodes for which performance monitoring results were collected during the current sample interval.

object.name: Device.HPNA.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.Nodes.Node.{i}.
object.description: Per-node HPNA performance monitoring results during the current sample interval. Each table entry contains the results collected between an HPNA node (as indicated by {{param|MACAddress}}) and the local HPNA interface (as indicated by {{param|##.Interface}}). Note: Packet counters indicate the number of packets received between {{param|#.CurrentStart}} and {{param|#.CurrentEnd}}.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of the HPNA node.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes sent by host equipment for transmission on the HPNA interface.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received bytes on the HPNA interface destined for the host equipment.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets sent by host equipment for transmission on the HPNA interface. Number includes also short error packets and control packets.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of good packets received on the HPNA interface destined for the host equipment.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The number of broadcast packets transmitted on the HPNA interface.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The number of broadcast packets received on the HPNA interface.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The number of multicast packets transmitted on the HPNA interface.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The number of multicast packets received on the HPNA interface.

parameter.name: PacketsCrcErrored
parameter.description: The number of packets received on the HPNA interface with CRC errors.

parameter.name: PacketsCrcErroredHost
parameter.description: The number of CRC error packets received on the HPNA interface destined for the host equipment.

parameter.name: PacketsShortErrored
parameter.description: The number of packets received on the HPNA interface that are too short to be valid.

parameter.name: PacketsShortErroredHost
parameter.description: The number packets sent by the host equipment that are too short to be valid.

parameter.name: RxPacketsDropped
parameter.description: The number of received packets dropped due to lack of resources.

parameter.name: TxPacketsDropped
parameter.description: The number packets sent by the host equipment for transmission on the HPNA interface but dropped due to lack of resources.

parameter.name: ControlRequestLocal
parameter.description: The number of HPNA control request packets from local host.

parameter.name: ControlReplyLocal
parameter.description: The number of HPNA control reply packets to local host.

parameter.name: ControlRequestRemote
parameter.description: The number of HPNA control request packets from remote host.

parameter.name: ControlReplyRemote
parameter.description: The number of HPNA control reply packets to remote host.

parameter.name: PacketsSentWire
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted to wire.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSentWire
parameter.description: The total number of broadcast packets transmitted to wire.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSentWire
parameter.description: The total number of multicast packets transmitted to wire.

parameter.name: PacketsInternalControl
parameter.description: The number of HPNA control request packets from internal node.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsInternalControl
parameter.description: The number of HPNA broadcast control request packets from internal node.

parameter.name: PacketsReceivedQueued
parameter.description: The number of received packets queued on host output queues.

parameter.name: PacketsReceivedForwardUnknown
parameter.description: The number of packets received and forwarded to unknown hosts.

parameter.name: NodeUtilization
parameter.description: The node utilization (expressed in {{units}}).

object.name: Device.HPNA.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.Channels.
object.description: Per-channel HPNA performance monitoring results. Note: channels are unidirectional.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: Time at which channel data was last collected.

parameter.name: ChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}} This is the number of HPNA channels for which performance monitoring results have been collected.

object.name: Device.HPNA.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.Channels.Channel.{i}.
object.description: Per-channel HPNA performance monitoring results.

parameter.name: HostSrcMACAddress
parameter.description: The host source MAC address associated with the channel.

parameter.name: HostDestMACAddress
parameter.description: The host destination MAC address associated with the channel.

parameter.name: HPNASrcMACAddress
parameter.description: The HPNA source MAC address associated with the channel.

parameter.name: HPNADestMACAddress
parameter.description: The HPNA destination MAC address associated with the channel.

parameter.name: PHYRate
parameter.description: Channel PHY rate (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: BaudRate
parameter.description: PHY Baud rate (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: SNR
parameter.description: Channel actual SNR measured in receiver side (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: Number of packets sent in the channel.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Pre-LARQ number of packets received in the channel.

parameter.name: LARQPacketsReceived
parameter.description: Post-LARQ number of packets received in the channel. Valid only if LARQ is enabled.

parameter.name: FlowSpec
parameter.description: {{reference}} Identifies the ''FlowSpec'' associated with the channel. This parameter is only used for channels that correspond to egress traffic from the local HPNA interface. {{null}} means that the channel is not associated with any specified flow specification in the QoS object.

object.name: Device.MoCA.
object.description: MoCA object that contains the {{object|Interface}} table {{bibref|MoCAv1.0}} {{bibref|MoCAv1.1}}.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.MoCA.Interface.{i}.
object.description: MoCA interface table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). Each table entry models the PHY and MAC levels of a MoCA interface {{bibref|MoCAv1.0}} {{bibref|MoCAv1.1}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the interface. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}. Note: Since {{object}} is a layer 1 interface, it is expected that {{param}} will not be used.

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}). For example: * For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces. * For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface. * For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the interface. Note: This is not necessarily the same as the Ethernet header source or destination MAC address, which is associated with the IP interface and is modeled via the {{param|.Ethernet.Link.{i}.MACAddress}} parameter.

parameter.name: FirmwareVersion
parameter.description: This interface's firmware version. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfSoftwareVersion'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum MoCA PHY bit rate (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: MaxIngressBW
parameter.description: The maximum bandwidth of this interface for flows onto the MoCA network in {{units}}. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfMaxIngressNodeBw'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: MaxEgressBW
parameter.description: The maximum bandwidth of this interface for flows from the MoCA network in {{units}}. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfMaxEgressNodeBw'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: HighestVersion
CurrentVersion
NetworkCoordinator
parameter.description: The Node ID of the current Network Coordinator (NC) for the MoCA network. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfNC'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: NodeID
parameter.description: The Node ID of this interface. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfNodeID'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: MaxNodes
parameter.description: The maximum network node capability supported by the interface. If {{param}} is {{true}} then the interface supports 16 nodes (the maximum for a MoCA 1.1 network). If {{param}} is false then the interface supports 8 nodes (the maximum for a MoCA 1.0 network).

parameter.name: PreferredNC
parameter.description: Whether this interface is a preferred Network Coordinator (NC). This parameter is based on ''mocaIfPreferredNC'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: BackupNC
parameter.description: The Node ID of the backup Network Coordinator node. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfBackupNC'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: PrivacyEnabledSetting
parameter.description: The configured privacy mode. This indicates whether link-layer security is enabled ({{true}}) or disabled ({{false}}) for network admission. The configured privacy setting MAY NOT match the current operational state ({{param|PrivacyEnabled}}), since this setting is only applied during network formation or admission.

parameter.name: PrivacyEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether link-layer security is enabled or disabled. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfPrivacyEnable'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: FreqCapabilityMask
parameter.description: Hexadecimal encoded 64-bit mask of supported frequencies. This is the bit map of the spectrum that the interface supports, and each bit represents 25 MHz of spectrum. The least significant bit of the rightmost character corresponds to 800MHz, which is the lowest frequency. For example, an interface that supports 1150 MHz through 1500 MHz would have a value of 0x000000001FFFC000. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfCapabilityMask'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: FreqCurrentMaskSetting
parameter.description: The configured hexadecimal encoded 64-bit mask of enabled frequencies for network admission. The configured frequencies MAY NOT match the current operational state ({{param|FreqCurrentMask}}), since this setting is only applied during network formation or admission.

parameter.name: FreqCurrentMask
parameter.description: Hexadecimal encoded 64-bit mask of used frequencies. This is the bit map of the spectrum that can be used and is a subset of the {{param|FreqCapabilityMask}}. Each bit represents 25 MHz of spectrum. The least significant bit of the rightmost character corresponds to 800MHz, which is the lowest frequency. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfChannelMask'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: CurrentOperFreq
parameter.description: Current Operational Frequency. The RF frequency in Hz to which the MoCA interface is currently tuned. This parameter is only valid when {{param|Status}} is {{enum|Up|Status}}. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfRFChannel'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: LastOperFreq
parameter.description: Last Operational Frequency. The RF frequency in Hz to which the MoCA interface was tuned when last in the {{enum|Up|Status}} state. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfLOF'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: KeyPassphrase
parameter.description: MoCA Password. The value consists of numeric characters (0-9). {{pattern}} This parameter is based on ''mocaIfPassword'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: TxPowerLimit
parameter.description: Transmit Power attenuation in dB relative to the maximum transmit power. The MoCA interface SHOULD have {{param|Enable}} set to {{false}} for any change in this configuration. If the parameter is modified when {{param|Enable}} is {{true}} then this change might take several minutes to complete. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfTxPowerLimit'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: PowerCntlPhyTarget
parameter.description: Target PHY rate in Mbps for the power control algorithm. The MoCA interface SHOULD have {{param|Enable}} set to {{false}} for any change in this configuration. If the parameter is modified when {{param|Enable}} is {{true}} then this change might take several minutes to complete. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfPowerControlTargetRate'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: BeaconPowerLimit
parameter.description: Beacon Transmit Power attenuation in {{units}} relative to the maximum transmit power. The MoCA interface SHOULD have {{param|Enable}} set to {{false}} for any change in this configuration. If the parameter is modified when {{param|Enable}} is {{true}} then this change might take several minutes to complete. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfBeaconPowerLimit'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: NetworkTabooMask
parameter.description: Hexadecimal encoded 64-bit mask of MoCA taboo channels identified for the home network. This is the bit map of the spectrum that the interface supports, and each bit represents 25 MHz of spectrum. The least significant bit of the rightmost character corresponds to 800MHz, which is the lowest frequency. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfTabooChannelMask'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: NodeTabooMask
parameter.description: Hexadecimal encoded 64-bit mask of supported frequencies. This is the bit map of the spectrum that the interface supports, and each bit represents 25 MHz of spectrum. The least significant bit of the rightmost character corresponds to 800MHz, which is the lowest frequency. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfNodeTabooChannelMask'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: TxBcastRate
parameter.description: The broadcast PHY transmit rate in {{units}} for this interface. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfTxGcdRate'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: TxBcastPowerReduction
parameter.description: Transmit Power attenuation in {{units}} relative to the maximum transmit power for broadcast transmissions. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfTxGcdPowerReduction'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: QAM256Capable
parameter.description: Whether this interface supports the 256 QAM feature. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfQAM256Capable'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: PacketAggregationCapability
parameter.description: The packet aggregation capability supported by the interface. Standard values are 0 (no support), 6 (6 {{units}}) or 10 (10 {{units}}). This parameter is based on ''mocaIfPacketsAggrCapability'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.MoCA.Interface.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

object.name: Device.MoCA.Interface.{i}.QoS.
object.description: The QoS object provides information on MoCA parameterized QoS for this interface {{bibref|MoCAv1.1}}.

parameter.name: EgressNumFlows
parameter.description: The number of QoS flows that this interface has from the MoCA network. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfEgressNodeNumFlows'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: IngressNumFlows
parameter.description: The number of QoS flows that this interface has onto the MoCA network. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfIngressNodeNumFlows'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: FlowStatsNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.MoCA.Interface.{i}.QoS.FlowStats.{i}.
object.description: The flow statistics table provides information on the MoCA parameterized QoS flows this interface has allocated onto the MoCA network.

parameter.name: FlowID
parameter.description: The flow ID used to identify a flow in the network. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfFlowID'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: PacketDA
parameter.description: The Destination Address (DA) for the packets in this flow. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfPacketDA'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: MaxRate
parameter.description: Maximum required rate in {{units}}. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfPeakDataRate'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: MaxBurstSize
parameter.description: Maximum burst size. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfBurstSize'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: LeaseTime
parameter.description: Flow lease time (expressed in {{units}}). A {{param}} of 0 means unlimited lease time. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfLeaseTime'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: LeaseTimeLeft
parameter.description: Flow lease time remaining (expressed in {{units}}). If {{param|LeaseTime}} is 0 then a {{param}} of 0 means unlimited lease time; otherwise, a {{param}} of 0 means expired. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfLeaseTimeLeft'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: FlowPackets
parameter.description: The number of packets transmitted for this flow. This parameter is based on ''mocaIfTxPacketsFlow'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

object.name: Device.MoCA.Interface.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.
object.description: This table contains information about other MoCA devices currently associated with this MoCA interface.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of the associated device's MoCA interface.

parameter.name: NodeID
parameter.description: The Node ID of this remote device. This parameter is based on ''mocaNodeIndex'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: PreferredNC
parameter.description: Whether this remote device is a preferred Network Coordinator (NC). This parameter is based on ''mocaNodePreferredNC'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: HighestVersion
PHYTxRate
parameter.description: The PHY transmit rate (in {{units}}) to this remote device. This parameter is based on ''mocaMeshTxRate'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: PHYRxRate
parameter.description: The PHY receive rate (in {{units}}) from this remote device.

parameter.name: TxPowerControlReduction
parameter.description: The reduction in transmitter level (in {{units}}) due to power control. This parameter is based on ''mocaNodeTxPowerReduction'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: RxPowerLevel
parameter.description: The power level (in {{units}}) received at the MoCA interface from this remote device. This parameter is based on ''mocaNodeRxPower'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: TxBcastRate
parameter.description: The broadcast PHY transmit rate (in {{units}}) from this remote device. This parameter is based on ''mocaNodeTxGcdRate'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: RxBcastPowerLevel
parameter.description: The power level (in {{units}}) received at the MoCA interface from this remote device. This parameter is based on ''mocaNodeRxGcdPower'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: TxPackets
parameter.description: The number of packets transmitted to this remote device (Note: Includes Broadcast, Multicast and Unicast packets).

parameter.name: RxPackets
parameter.description: The number of packets received from this remote device (Note: Includes Broadcast, Multicast and Unicast packets). This parameter is based on ''mocaNodeRxPackets'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: RxErroredAndMissedPackets
parameter.description: The number of errored and missed packets received from this remote device. This parameter is based on ''mocaNodeRxDrops'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: QAM256Capable
parameter.description: Whether this remote device supports the 256 QAM feature. This parameter is based on ''mocaNodeQAM256Capable'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: PacketAggregationCapability
parameter.description: The packet aggregation capability supported by the remote device. Standard values are 0 (no support), 6 (6 {{units}}) or 10 (10 {{units}}). This parameter is based on ''mocaNodePacketsAggrCapability'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: RxSNR
parameter.description: The signal to noise level (in {{units}}) received at this interface from this remote device. This parameter is based on ''mocaNodeSNR'' from {{bibref|MOCA11-MIB}}.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.description: Whether or not this remote device is currently present in the MoCA network. The ability to list inactive nodes is OPTIONAL. If the CPE includes inactive nodes in this table, {{param}} MUST be set to {{false}} for each inactive node. The length of time an inactive node remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

object.name: Device.Ghn.
object.description: G.hn object that contains an {{object|Interface}} table for G.hn supported CPE. The ITU-T G.hn specifications {{bibref|G.9960}} and {{bibref|G.9961}} define Physical and MAC Layers for communication between two or more G.hn nodes in the home network over multiple wired media such as power line, phone line and coaxial cable.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
