parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.Ghn.Interface.{i}.
object.description: G.hn interface table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). Each table entry models the PHY {{bibref|G.9960}} and MAC {{bibref|G.9961}} layers of a G.hn interface.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the interface. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}. Note: Since {{object}} is a layer 1 interface, it is expected that {{param}} will not be used.

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}). For example: * For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces. * For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface. * For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the interface, denoted as node MAC address or REGID in {{bibref|G.9961}}. Note: This is not necessarily the same as the Ethernet header source or destination MAC address, which is associated with the IP interface and is modeled via the {{param|.Ethernet.Link.{i}.MACAddress}} parameter.

parameter.name: FirmwareVersion
parameter.description: The firmware version of the interface.

parameter.name: ConnectionType
parameter.description: This parameter is DEPRECATED because it has been replaced by {{param|MediumType}}.

parameter.name: MaxTransmitRate
parameter.description: The maximum PHY data rate that the interface is capable of transmitting (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: TargetDomainNames
parameter.description: {{list}} Identifies the target domains configured by the user, as described in {{bibref|G.9961|Section 8.6.1}}. When registering or re-registering, the G.hn interface SHOULD try to register to one of these domains in the given order.

parameter.name: DomainName
parameter.description: This is the domain name to which the interface is currently registered. {{empty}} indicates that the interface is currently not registered.

parameter.name: DomainNameIdentifier
parameter.description: The Domain Name Identifier, a shortened version of {{param|DomainName}}, denoted as DNI in {{bibref|G.9961|Section 8.6.11.2.1}}.

parameter.name: DomainId
parameter.description: The Domain Identifier of the domain to which the interface is registered, denoted as DOD in {{bibref|G.9961}}.

parameter.name: DeviceId
parameter.description: The Device Identifier assigned by the Domain Master, denoted as DEVICE_ID in {{bibref|G.9961}}. The value 0 indicates that the device is not currently registered.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum PHY bit rate supported by this interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: NodeTypeDMCapable
parameter.description: Indicates whether this interface has the capability to act as Domain Master in the G.hn domain.

parameter.name: DMRequested
parameter.description: Indicates a request to force the role of the G.hn interface to Domain Master (DM) for the G.hn domain it is connected to. The selection of the Domain Master follows the procedures described in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.6.6}}.

parameter.name: IsDM
parameter.description: Indicates whether this G.hn interface is currently the Domain Master (DM) for the G.hn domain it is connected to, as described in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.6}}.

parameter.name: NodeTypeSCCapable
parameter.description: Indicates whether this interface has the capability to act as Security Controller in the G.hn domain.

parameter.name: SCRequested
parameter.description: Indicates a request to force the role of the G.hn interface to Security Controller (SC) for the G.hn domain it is connected to. The selection of the Security Controller follows the procedures described in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 9.2}}.

parameter.name: IsSC
parameter.description: Indicates whether this G.hn interface is currently the Security Controller (SC) for the G.hn domain it is connected to, as described in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 9.2}}.

parameter.name: StandardVersions
parameter.description: The standard versions that the interface supports. The list MUST have an even number of items. The first item of each pair represents an ITU-T G.hn Recommendation while the second element of each pair represents the amendment version of the indicated Recommendation that this interface supports (the value 0 corresponds to the base Recommendation). For example, to indicate support for the G.9960 base document and G.9961 amendment 1, the corresponding list would be "G9960,0,G9961,1".

parameter.name: MaxBandPlan
parameter.description: The largest bandplan that the interface can support, as defined in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.8.5.5}}.

parameter.name: MediumType
parameter.description: The medium type that the interface currently operates on. Refer to {{bibref|G.9962|Table 7-5}}.

parameter.name: TAIFG
parameter.description: The Acknowledgement InterFrame Gap, or TAIFG, as defined in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.4}}. It is represented as multiples of {{units}}.

parameter.name: NotchedAmateurRadioBands
parameter.description: A bit map representing usage of international amateur bands (0 = masked, 1 = unmasked). The LSB represents the lowest band (1.8-2.0 MHz), the second LSB represents the second lowest band (3.5-4.0 MHz), and so on. The maximum value for this parameter is 0x03FF, i.e. it is a 10-bit quantity represented in 16 bits and the top 6 bits are always zero. International Radio amateur bands are described in {{bibref|G.9964|Table D-1}} and conveyed by the Domain Master in the Amateur radio band descriptor (see {{bibref|G.9961|Table 8-77}}).

parameter.name: PHYThroughputDiagnosticsEnable
parameter.description: Comma-separated list of DeviceIDs of nodes that need to enable their PHY throughput diagnostics mode. All devices that are enabled will participate in the G.hn network PHY throughput diagnostics process.

parameter.name: PerformanceMonitoringDiagnosticsEnable
parameter.description: Comma-separated list of DeviceIDs of nodes that need to enable their Performance Monitoring diagnostics mode on this node. All devices that are enabled will participate in the G.hn network Performance Monitoring diagnostics process.

parameter.name: SMMaskedBandNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: NodeTypeDMConfig
parameter.description: Requests the interface to become the Domain Master in the G.hn domain. This parameter is valid only if {{param|NodeTypeDMCapable}} is {{true}}. Note that, if more than one node is configured to act as Domain Master, G.hn specifies a protocol to ensure only one device actually becomes DM.

parameter.name: NodeTypeDMStatus
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface is acting as Domain Master ({{true}}) or not ({{false}}). See Note in {{param|NodeTypeDMConfig}} regarding the possibility of more than one node being configured with {{param|NodeTypeDMConfig}} = {{true}}.

parameter.name: NodeTypeSCStatus
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface is acting as Security Controller ({{true}}) or not ({{false}}).

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: PSM

object.name: Device.Ghn.Interface.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface at the different G.hn reference points described in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.1}}. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. More specifically, this is the total number of MPDU bytes transmitted or retransmitted by the node through a physical medium (i.e., PMI defined in {{bibref|G.9960|Clause 5.2.1}}), which correspond to data LPDUs (i.e., data packets) and framing overhead (e.g., LFH, LPH, LPCS defined in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.1}}). It does not include transmitted bytes contributed by management LPDUs (i.e., management packets). Note: LPDUs in mixed LLC frame blocks are considered data LPDUs.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters. More specifically, this is the total number of MPDU bytes received by the node through a physical medium, which correspond to data LPDUs and framing overhead. It does not include received bytes contributed by management LPDUs. It can include blocks with errors. Note: LPDUs in mixed LLC frame blocks are considered data LPDUs.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface. More specifically, this is the total number of APDUs requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point defined in {{bibref|G.9960|Clause 5.2.1}}) that were transmitted by the node through the physical medium. It does not include transmitted LCDUs.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface. More specifically, this is the total number of APDUs delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) that were received by the node through the physical medium. It does not include received LCDUs.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. More specifically, this is the total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point defined in {{bibref|G.9960|Clause 5.2.1}}) but could not be transmitted because of errors (e.g., APDUs containing CRC errors).

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol. More specifically, this is the total number of received APDUs that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point defined in {{bibref|G.9960|Clause 5.2.1}}). The possible causes of error are: incorrect CRC, incorrect MIC, incorrect MIC size, and incorrect size of packet.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. More specifically, this is the total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a unicast address at this layer. It includes APDUs that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer. More specifically, this is the total number of received APDUs that were delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a unicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. More specifically, this is the total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) but chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted (e.g., buffer overflow).

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. More specifically, this is the total number of received APDUs that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. More specifically, this is the total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer. It includes APDUs that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer. More specifically, this is the total number of received APDUs that were delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. More specifically, this is the total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer. It includes APDUs that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer. More specifically, this is the total number of received APDUs that were delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. More specifically, this is the total number of APDUs received by the management that were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

parameter.name: MgmtBytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of MPDU bytes transmitted by the node through a physical medium, which correspond to management LPDUs and framing overhead.

parameter.name: MgmtBytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of MPDU bytes received by the node through a physical medium, which correspond to management LPDUs and framing overhead.

parameter.name: MgmtPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of LCDUs requested for transmission by a management layer (i.e., outbound LCDUs generated in LLC defined in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.1.3}}) that were transmitted by the node through a physical medium.

parameter.name: MgmtPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of LCDUs delivered to a management layer (i.e., inbound LCDUs) that were received by the node through a physical medium.

parameter.name: BlocksSent
parameter.description: The total number of LPDUs that were transmitted by the node through a physical medium, regardless of new or retransmitted LPDUs.

parameter.name: BlocksReceived
parameter.description: The total number of LPDUs that were received by the node through a physical medium, with or without errors.

parameter.name: BlocksResent
parameter.description: The total number of LPDUs that were retransmitted.

parameter.name: BlocksErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received LPDUs that contained errors. Note the following relationships hold: * PacketsSent + ErrorsSent + DiscardPacketsSent = UnicastPacketsSent + MulticastPacketsSent + BroadcastPacketsSent. * PacketsReceived = UnicastPacketsReceived + MulticastPacketsReceived + BroadcastPacketsReceived. * Retransmission rate = BlocksResent / BlocksSent. * Block error rate = BlocksErrorReceived / BlocksReceived.

object.name: Device.Ghn.Interface.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.
object.description: This table contains information about other G.hn devices connected to this G.hn interface.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of remote G.hn device. This is denoted as REGID in {{bibref|G.9961}}.

parameter.name: DeviceId
parameter.description: Device Id (as defined in G.hn) for the remote G.hn device, denoted as DEVICE_ID in {{bibref|G.9961}}.

parameter.name: TxPhyRate
parameter.description: The PHY transmit Rate (expressed in {{units}}) to this remote device, denoted as PHY data rate in {{bibref|G.9961}}. Refer to Note 1 of {{bibref|G.9961|Table 8-48}}. To convert from the value in the table, divide by 32K (32768) and round down.

parameter.name: RxPhyRate
parameter.description: The PHY receive Rate (expressed in {{units}}) from this remote device, denoted as PHY data rate in {{bibref|G.9961}}. Refer to Note 1 of {{bibref|G.9961|Table 8-48}}. To convert from the value in the table, divide by 32K (32768) and round down.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.description: Whether or not this device is currently present in the G.hn domain. The ability to list inactive nodes is OPTIONAL. If the CPE includes inactive nodes in this table, {{param}} MUST be set to {{false}} for each inactive node. The length of time an inactive node remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE. If {{param}} is {{true}}, it indicates that the Status of the remote device is 0, 1, or 2 (see {{bibref|G.9961|Table 7-3}}).

object.name: Device.Ghn.Interface.{i}.DMInfo.
object.description: This object specifies management parameters pertaining to the domain functionality (Domain Master function; see {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.6}}). The object exists only on G.hn interfaces that are currently the Domain Master, i.e. for which parameter {{param|#.IsDM}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: DomainName
parameter.description: This is the domain name to which the interface is currently registered. {{empty}} indicates that the interface is currently not registered.

parameter.name: DomainNameIdentifier
parameter.description: The Domain Name Identifier, a shortened version of {{param|DomainName}}, denoted as DNI in {{bibref|G.9961|Section 8.6.11.2.1}}.

parameter.name: DomainId
parameter.description: The Domain Identifier of the domain to which the interface is registered, denoted as DOD in {{bibref|G.9961}}.

parameter.name: MACCycleDuration
parameter.description: The MAC cycle duration, as specified in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.4}}. It is represented as multiples of {{units}}. In the case of power line, writing to this parameter has no effect and it reads back as 0, which is a special value indicating that the MAC cycle is synchronized with 2 AC cycles as defined in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.6.3.1}}.

parameter.name: SCDeviceId
parameter.description: The DEVICE_ID of the Security Controller selected by the Domain Master.

parameter.name: SCMACAddress
parameter.description: The REGID of the Security Controller selected by the Domain Master.

parameter.name: ReregistrationTimePeriod
parameter.description: The time interval for periodic re-registration, as specified in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.8.5.8}}. It is represented as multiples of {{units}}.

parameter.name: TopologyPeriodicInterval
parameter.description: The time interval that a node sends out the periodic topology update using TM_NodeTopologyChange.ind message, as specified in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.8.5.8.1}}. It is represented as multiples of {{units}}. The special value 0 represents an infinite interval (i.e., no periodic topology update).

parameter.name: MinSupportedBandplan
parameter.description: Indicates the value of the minimal bandplan capability for a node that is allowed to register to the domain.

parameter.name: MaxSupportedBandplan
parameter.description: Indicates the value of the minimal bandplan capability for a node that is allowed to register to the domain.

object.name: Device.Ghn.Interface.{i}.SCInfo.
object.description: This object specifies management parameters pertaining to the Security Controller functionality (Security Controller function; see {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 9.2}}). The object exists only on G.hn interfaces that are currently the Security Controller, i.e. for which parameter {{param|#.IsSC}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: ModesSupported
parameter.description: The security modes that the Security Controller can support. Refer to {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 9.2}}.

parameter.name: ModeEnabled
parameter.description: The security mode in which the Security Controller is operating.

parameter.name: MICSize
parameter.description: The selected MIC size used in the domain.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.description: Indicates whether the Security Controller is above the L1 reference point. It is set to {{true}} if the Security Controller is above the L1 reference point, and set to {{false}} otherwise.

object.name: Device.Ghn.Interface.{i}.SMMaskedBand.{i}.
object.description: Specifies the list of masked bands to be applied to the G.hn interface. This information is conveyed by the Domain Master in the SM descriptor as specified in {{bibref|G.9961|Table 8-77}}. Instances of this object are expected to exist only on G.hn interfaces that are currently the Domain Master, i.e. for which parameter {{param|#.IsDM}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}}.

parameter.name: BandNumber
parameter.description: The masked band number.

parameter.name: StartSubCarrier
parameter.description: Index of the lowest frequency sub-carrier in the band to be masked as specified in {{bibref|G.9961|Table 8-79}}. This parameter is writable only on the interface which acts as the Domain Master.

parameter.name: StopSubCarrier
parameter.description: Index of the highest frequency sub-carrier in the band to be masked as specified in Table 8-79 in {{bibref|G.9961}}. This parameter is writable only on the interface which acts as the Domain Master.

object.name: Device.Ghn.Diagnostics.
object.description: The G.hn Diagnostics object.

object.name: Device.Ghn.Diagnostics.PHYThroughput.
object.description: G.hn PHY throughput diagnostics configuration and results. When diagnostics are requested, all G.hn nodes for which the {{param|##.Interface.{i}.PHYThroughputDiagnosticsEnable}} parameter is set enter PHY diagnostics mode.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: The interface over which the test is to be performed.

parameter.name: DiagnoseMACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of the originating G.hn interface of the link that is being diagnosed. Note: This MAC address might belong to another node of the domain.

parameter.name: PHYThroughputResultNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.Ghn.Diagnostics.PHYThroughput.Result.{i}.
object.description: PHY throughput diagnostics results.

parameter.name: DestinationMACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of the destination node of the link being measured.

parameter.name: LinkState
parameter.description: Indicates the state of the link between the G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|#.DiagnoseMACAddress}} and the G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|DestinationMACAddress}}.

enumeration.description: There is a direct link between G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|#.DiagnoseMACAddress}} and G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|DestinationMACAddress}}
There is no direct link between G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|#.DiagnoseMACAddress}} and G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|DestinationMACAddress}}

parameter.name: TxPhyRate
parameter.description: PHY data rate in transmit direction in the link between the G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|#.DiagnoseMACAddress}} and the G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|DestinationMACAddress}}. It is represented in {{units}} as defined in Note 1 to {{bibref|G.9961|Table 8-48}}. To convert from the value in the table, divide by 32K (32768) and round down.

parameter.name: RxPhyRate
parameter.description: PHY data rate in receive direction in the link between the G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|#.DiagnoseMACAddress}} and the G.hn Interface with MAC address {{param|DestinationMACAddress}}. It is represented in {{units}} as defined in Note 1 to {{bibref|G.9961|Table 8-48}}. To convert from the value in the table, divide by 32K (32768) and round down.

object.name: Device.Ghn.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.
object.description: G.hn Performance Monitoring diagnostics configuration and results. When diagnostics are requested, all G.hn nodes for which the {{param|##.Interface.{i}.PerformanceMonitoringDiagnosticsEnable}} parameter is set enter PHY diagnostics mode.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: The interface over which the test is to be performed.

parameter.name: DiagnoseMACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of the originating G.hn interface of the link that is being diagnosed. Note: This MAC address might belong to another node of the domain.

parameter.name: SampleInterval
parameter.description: Time in {{units}} between automatic collection of performance monitoring data. A value of zero disables automatic collection of data. The node MAY impose a minimum sample interval, in which case an attempt to set a (non-zero) interval that is less than this minimum MUST set the interval to the minimum and MUST NOT be regarded as an error. If SampleInterval is a simple fraction of a day, e.g. 900 (a quarter of an hour) or 3600 (an hour), the device MAY choose to align sample intervals with time of day, but is not required to do so.

parameter.name: SNRGroupLength
parameter.description: The number of sub-carriers in a group to be used for averaging SNR values when providing SNR information for a channel.

object.name: Device.Ghn.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.Nodes.
object.description: Per-node G.hn performance monitoring results. When automatic collection is enabled, i.e. {{param|#.SampleInterval}} is non-zero, the "current" interval is defined by the most recent automatic sample and the most recent subsequent manual sample, if any. When automatic collection is disabled, i.e. SampleInterval is zero, the "current" interval is defined by the three most recent manual samples. Note: Packets in statistics counters are Ethernet packets.

parameter.name: CurrentStart
parameter.description: Start time for the current interval. When automatic collection is enabled, i.e. SampleInterval is non-zero, the current interval started at the most recent automatic sample. When automatic collection is disabled, i.e. SampleInterval is zero, the current interval started two manual samples ago.

parameter.name: CurrentEnd
parameter.description: End time for the current interval. When automatic collection is enabled, i.e. SampleInterval is non-zero, the current interval ended at the most recent manual sample since the most recent automatic sample. If there has been no such manual sample, the current interval is empty. When automatic collection is disabled, i.e. SampleInterval is zero, the current interval ended at the most recent manual sample.

parameter.name: NodeNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}} This is the number of G.hn nodes for which performance monitoring results were collected during the current sample interval.

object.name: Device.Ghn.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.Nodes.Node.{i}.
object.description: Per-node G.hn performance monitoring results during the current sample interval. Each table entry contains the results collected between the G.hn nodes with MAC addresses {{param|##.DiagnoseMACAddress}}) and {{param|DestinationMACAddress}}). Note: Packet counters indicate the number of packets received between {{param|#.CurrentStart}} and {{param|#.CurrentEnd}}.

parameter.name: DestinationMACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of the destination node of the link being measured.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of MPDU bytes transmitted or retransmitted by the node through a physical medium (i.e., PMI defined in {{bibref|G.9960|Clause 5.2.1}}), which correspond to data LPDUs (i.e., data packets) and framing overhead (e.g., LFH, LPH, LPCS defined in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.1}}). It does not include transmitted bytes contributed by management LPDUs (i.e., management packets). Note: LPDUs in mixed LLC frame blocks are considered data LPDUs.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of MPDU bytes received by the node through a physical medium, which correspond to data LPDUs and framing overhead. It does not include received bytes contributed by management LPDUs. It might include blocks with errors. Note: LPDUs in mixed LLC frame blocks are considered data LPDUs.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of APDUs requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point defined in {{bibref|G.9960|Clause 5.2.1}}) that were transmitted by the node through the physical medium. It does not include transmitted LCDUs.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of APDUs delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) that were received by the node through the physical medium. It does not include received LCDUs.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point defined in {{bibref|G.9960|Clause 5.2.1}}). This parameter represents the total number of LCDUs requested for transmission by a management layer (i.e., outbound LCDUs generated in LLC defined in in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.1.3}}) that were transmitted by the node through a physical medium) but could not be transmitted because of errors (e.g., APDUs containing CRC errors).

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received APDUs that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point defined in {{bibref|G.9960|Clause 5.2.1}}). The possible causes of error are: incorrect CRC, incorrect MIC, incorrect MIC size, and incorrect size of packet.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a unicast address at this layer. It includes APDUs that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received APDUs that were delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a unicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) but chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted (e.g., buffer overflow).

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received APDUs that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer. It includes APDUs that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received APDUs that were delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of APDUs that were requested for transmission by a higher layer (i.e., outbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer. It includes APDUs that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received APDUs that were delivered to a higher layer (i.e., inbound APDUs at the x1 reference point) and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of APDUs received by the management that were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

parameter.name: MgmtBytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of MPDU bytes transmitted by the node through a physical medium, which correspond to management LPDUs and framing overhead.

parameter.name: MgmtBytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of MPDU bytes received by the node through a physical medium, which correspond to management LPDUs and framing overhead.

parameter.name: MgmtPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of LCDUs requested for transmission by a management layer (i.e., outbound LCDUs generated in LLC defined in {{bibref|G.9961|Clause 8.1.3}}) that were transmitted by the node through a physical medium.

parameter.name: MgmtPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of LCDUs delivered to a management layer (i.e., inbound LCDUs) that were received by the node through a physical medium.

parameter.name: BlocksSent
parameter.description: The total number of LPDUs that were transmitted by the node through a physical medium, regardless of new or retransmitted LPDUs.

parameter.name: BlocksReceived
parameter.description: The total number of LPDUs that were received by the node through a physical medium, with or without errors.

parameter.name: BlocksResent
parameter.description: The total number of LPDUs that were retransmitted.

parameter.name: BlocksErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received LPDUs that contained errors. Note the following relationships hold: * PacketsSent + ErrorsSent + DiscardPacketsSent = UnicastPacketsSent + MulticastPacketsSent + BroadcastPacketsSent. * PacketsReceived = UnicastPacketsReceived + MulticastPacketsReceived + BroadcastPacketsReceived. * Retransmission rate = BlocksResent / BlocksSent. * Block error rate = BlocksErrorReceived / BlocksReceived.

object.name: Device.Ghn.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.Channels.
object.description: Per-channel G.hn performance monitoring results. Note: channels are unidirectional.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: Time at which channel data was last collected.

parameter.name: ChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.Ghn.Diagnostics.PerformanceMonitoring.Channels.Channel.{i}.
object.description: Per-channel G.hn performance monitoring results during the current sample interval. Each table entry contains the results collected from the channel between a G.hn interface (as indicated by {{param|##.DiagnoseMACAddress}}) and a G.hn interface indicated by {{param|DestinationMACAddress}})

parameter.name: DestinationMACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of the destination node of the link being measured.

parameter.name: SNR
parameter.description: The result of an SNR test performed over the channel. It is formatted as a comma-separated list of N/M unsigned integers that represents the result of Signal-to-Noise-Ratio measurement averaging in groups of M subcarriers. The number N depends on the bandplan used by the node and corresponds to the OFDM control parameter N of each medium as defined in {{bibref|G.9964}}. The number M corresponds to the parameter {{param|##.SNRGroupLength}}.

object.name: Device.HomePlug.
object.description: HomePlug object that contains the {{object|Interface}} table. The HomePlug industry standard {{bibref|HPAV1.1}} defines peer to peer communication over powerline medium.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.HomePlug.Interface.{i}.
object.description: HomePlug interface table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). Each table entry models the PHY and MAC levels of a HomePlug interface {{bibref|HPAV1.1}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the interface. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}. Note: Since {{object}} is a layer 1 interface, it is expected that {{param}} will not be used.

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}). For example: * For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces. * For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface. * For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the interface. Note: This is not necessarily the same as the Ethernet header source or destination MAC address, which is associated with the IP interface and is modeled via the {{param|.Ethernet.Link.{i}.MACAddress}} parameter.

parameter.name: LogicalNetwork
parameter.description: The textual name of the HomePlug Logical Network.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: Indicates the HomePlug version of the interface. This element SHOULD be in the form of dot-delimited integers, where each successive integer represents a more minor category of variation. For example: : "1.0" : "1.1"

parameter.name: FirmwareVersion
parameter.description: The firmware version of the interface.

parameter.name: ForceCCo
parameter.description: Central Coordinator (CCo) selection mode. If {{false}}, CCo selection is automatic. If {{true}}, the local HomePlug interface is forced to be CCo and all other devices in the Logical Network MUST be set to automatic CCo selection. Typically {{param}} is set to automatic CCo selection ({{false}}).

parameter.name: NetworkPassword
parameter.description: The network password of the device. This is a human readable ASCII string that is hashed per the HomePlug specification to generate the Network Membership Key (NMK). Note that care needs to be taken when setting this parameter as it might prohibit communication with other adapters or equipment connected via the powerline network.

parameter.name: OtherNetworksPresent
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates whether any other HomePlug networks are currently visible via this interface. Examples of valid list items include, but are not limited to: : "HomePlugAV" : "HomePlug1.0" : "Other"

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum PHY bit rate supported by this interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.HomePlug.Interface.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

parameter.name: MPDUTxAck
parameter.description: HomePlug-specific statistic. The Number of MAC Protocol Data Units (MPDUs) Transmitted and Acknowledged.

parameter.name: MPDUTxCol
parameter.description: HomePlug-specific statistic. The Number of MAC Protocol Data Units (MPDUs) Transmitted and Collided

parameter.name: MPDUTxFailed
parameter.description: HomePlug-specific statistic. The Number of MAC Protocol Data Units (MPDUs) Transmitted and Failed

parameter.name: MPDURxAck
parameter.description: HomePlug-specific statistic. The Number of MAC Protocol Data Units (MPDUs) Received and Acknowledged

parameter.name: MPDURxFailed
parameter.description: HomePlug-specific statistic. The Number of MAC Protocol Data Units (MPDUs) Received and Failed

object.name: Device.HomePlug.Interface.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.
object.description: This table contains information about other HomePlug devices connected to this HomePlug interface.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of remote HomePlug device. It is used to uniquely identify and easily correlate with the connected remote HomePlug device.

parameter.name: TxPhyRate
parameter.description: The PHY transmit Rate (expressed in {{units}}) to this remote device.

parameter.name: RxPhyRate
parameter.description: The PHY receive Rate (expressed in {{units}}) from this remote device.

parameter.name: SNRPerTone
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate Signal to Noise Ratio (SNR) per tone from this remote device (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: AvgAttenuation
parameter.description: Average attenuation from this remote device (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: EndStationMACs
parameter.description: {{list}} List items represent MAC addresses of end stations bridged by the remote HomePlug device. For example: "11:22:33:AA:BB:CC, 22:33:44:DD:EE:66"

parameter.name: Active
parameter.description: Whether or not this device is currently present in the HomePlug network. The ability to list inactive nodes is OPTIONAL. If the CPE includes inactive nodes in this table, {{param}} MUST be set to {{false}} for each inactive node. The length of time an inactive node remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

object.name: Device.UPA.
object.description: Universal Powerline Association {{bibref|UPA-PLC}}. This object contains the {{object|Interface}} and {{object|Diagnostics}} objects.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.UPA.Interface.{i}.
object.description: UPA interface table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). Each table entry models the PHY and MAC levels of a UPA interface {{bibref|UPA-PLC}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the interface. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}. Note: Since {{object}} is a layer 1 interface, it is expected that {{param}} will not be used.

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}). For example: * For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces. * For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface. * For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the interface. Note: This is not necessarily the same as the Ethernet header source or destination MAC address, which is associated with the IP interface and is modeled via the {{param|.Ethernet.Link.{i}.MACAddress}} parameter.

parameter.name: FirmwareVersion
parameter.description: This interface's firmware version.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum PHY bit rate supported by this interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: NodeType
parameter.description: Type of UPA device role. It can be Fixed Access Point (master) or End Point (slave) of the PLC network. {{enum}}

parameter.name: LogicalNetwork
parameter.description: The name (network ID) of the logical PLC network in which the local interface is a member (human readable string).

parameter.name: EncryptionMethod
parameter.description: Encryption Method used by UPA device. {{enum}}

parameter.name: EncryptionKey
parameter.description: Encryption key for secure PLC communications. This a human readable string used by the system to generate the encryption key to encrypt communications in powerline. It takes non extended ASCII characters (i.e. printable 7-bit ASCII character codes 32-126, which includes SPACE but excludes TAB, LF and CR). For example: bvjPekZiYUf9kjNKJASkgJ09adfoP01Fjvgd

parameter.name: PowerBackoffEnabled
parameter.description: Power back-off management feature status in the UPA device. Boolean can be {{true}} for "enabled" and {{false}} for "disabled".

parameter.name: PowerBackoffMechanismActive
parameter.description: Show if power back-off mechanism is active at that time in the UPA device. Boolean can be {{true}} for "active" and {{false}} for "not active".

parameter.name: EstApplicationThroughput
parameter.description: The estimated application throughput (expressed in {{units}}), received from the PLC link. This value can be used to indicate link quality.

parameter.name: ActiveNotchEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object|ActiveNotch}} table for this interface.

parameter.name: ActiveNotchNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: BridgeForNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.UPA.Interface.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

object.name: Device.UPA.Interface.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.
object.description: This table contains information about PLC connections running between this UPA interface and other UPA devices.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: Remote UPA device MAC address.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: The PLC port number.

parameter.name: LogicalNetwork
parameter.description: The name of the logical PLC network (human readable string). In the case where the associated device belongs to a different powerline network than the UPA interface, the actual network identifier of the neighboring network is not shown in {{param}}. Rather, only a generic string, e.g. "Network 1", "Network 2", etc is stored here due to security/privacy implications.

parameter.name: PhyTxThroughput
parameter.description: Physical transmission throughput (in {{units}}).

parameter.name: PhyRxThroughput
parameter.description: Physical reception throughput (in {{units}}).

parameter.name: RealPhyRxThroughput
parameter.description: Real Physical reception throughput (in {{units}}).

parameter.name: EstimatedPLR
parameter.description: Estimated PDU Loss Rate measurement between two devices (i.e. estimated {{units}} of MPDUs that have been received with errors).

parameter.name: MeanEstimatedAtt
parameter.description: Mean estimated attenuation (i.e. channel loss between the local interface and the remote device). It is measured in {{units}}.

parameter.name: SmartRouteIntermediatePLCMAC
parameter.description: Intermediate UPA adapter MAC address of the device that is acting as a relay to increase coverage in mesh scenarios. This is the MAC address of a third UPA device, with which the UPA interface is doing smart repeating in order to transmit data to the associated {{param|MACAddress}} UPA device. {{param}} will be empty when {{param|DirectRoute}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: DirectRoute
parameter.description: Route status, where {{true}} indicates ''direct'' and {{false}} indicates ''indirect''.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.description: Whether or not this node is currently present in the UPA network. The ability to list inactive nodes is OPTIONAL. If the CPE includes inactive nodes in this table, {{param}} MUST be set to {{false}} for each inactive node. The length of time an inactive node remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

object.name: Device.UPA.Interface.{i}.ActiveNotch.{i}.
object.description: This object contains the list of active notches of the UPA interface. A UPA device can have notches in its spectrum, where no power is transmitted in a given part of the spectrum. These notches are typically located in amateur radio bands, to avoid interference. Note: All {{object}} entries can be enabled/disabled as a group using the {{param|#.ActiveNotchEnable}} parameter.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the active notch entry.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: StartFreq
parameter.description: The initial frequency (in {{units}}) of a notch enabled in the spectrum of the local interface.

parameter.name: StopFreq
parameter.description: The final frequency (in {{units}}) of a notch enabled in the spectrum of the local interface.

parameter.name: Depth
parameter.description: The depth (in {{units}}) of a notch enabled in the spectrum of the local interface.

object.name: Device.UPA.Interface.{i}.BridgeFor.{i}.
object.description: This object represents the bridge table of the UPA interface. Each instance is a bridge table entry. It shows the MAC addresses of the remote UPA devices with their associated port number, and the MAC addresses of the end-devices (PCs, STBs, routers, etc) connected to Ethernet port of the powerline adapters with their associated logical port. In this way the system identifies to which UPA device an external device is connected to.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of the device.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: Internal bridge associated port.

object.name: Device.UPA.Diagnostics.
object.description: The UPA Diagnostics object.

object.name: Device.UPA.Diagnostics.InterfaceMeasurement.
object.description: This object provides access to either a Signal-to-Noise-Ratio (SNR) Port Measurement test or a Channel Frequency Response (CFR) Port Measurement test. The {{param|Type}} parameter is used to select which type of test to perform. CFR and SNR measurements are done between a two UPA devices (a local interface and a remote device belonging to the same network).

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Indicates the type of port measurement test to be carried out. {{enum}}.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: {{reference}} This is the local UPA interface from which the test is to be performed.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: PLC port being measured. This identifies which PLC connection to measure between the local interface (indicated by {{param|Interface}}) and the remote device (implied by {{param}}).

parameter.name: Measurements
parameter.description: {{list}} Result of Signal-to-Noise-Ratio measurement (if {{param|Type}} is {{enum|SNR|Type}}) or Channel Frequency Response measurement (if {{param|Type}} is {{enum|CFR|Type}}). List items indicate measurements per carrier for a PLC port (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: RxGain
parameter.description: Reception gain of the adapter (expresssed in {{units}}).

object.name: Device.WiFi.
object.description: The WiFi object is based on the WiFi Alliance 802.11 specifications ({{bibref|802.11-2007}}). It defines interface objects ({{object|Radio}} and {{object|SSID}}), and application objects ({{object|AccessPoint}} and {{object|EndPoint}}).

parameter.name: RadioNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: SSIDNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: AccessPointNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: EndPointNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ResetCounter
parameter.description: This parameter counts the number of WiFi host or driver resets since the last device reset. This parameter is reset to zero after the device resets, and increments with each successive WiFi host or driver reset.

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: This parameter represents a request to reset or reboot the WiFi sub-system without resetting or rebooting the device.

object.name: Device.WiFi.Radio.{i}.
object.description: This object models an 802.11 wireless radio on a device (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). If the device can establish more than one connection simultaneously (e.g. a dual radio device), a separate {{object}} instance MUST be used for each physical radio of the device. See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Appendix III.1}} for additional information. Note: A dual-band single-radio device (e.g. an 802.11a/b/g radio) can be configured to operate at 2.4 or 5 GHz frequency bands, but only a single frequency band is used to transmit/receive at a given time. Therefore, a single {{object}} instance is used even for a dual-band radio.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the radio. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the radio (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the radio as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the radio entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}. Note: Since {{object}} is a layer 1 interface, it is expected that {{param}} will not be used.

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}). For example: * For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces. * For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface. * For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces. This parameter is DEPRECATED because it gives a wrong indication for multiple SSIDs. Use the {{param|#.SSID.{i}.Upstream}} parameter instead.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum PHY bit rate supported by this interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: SupportedFrequencyBands
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate the frequency bands at which the radio can operate.

parameter.name: OperatingFrequencyBand
parameter.description: Indicates the frequency band at which the radio is operating. If the radio supports multiple bands, and {{param}} is changed, then all parameters whose value is not valid for the new frequency band (e.g. {{param|Channel}}) MUST be set to a valid value (according to some CPE vendor-specific behavior).

parameter.name: SupportedStandards
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate which IEEE 802.11 standards this {{object}} instance can support simultaneously, in the frequency band specified by {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}}. {{enum}} Each value indicates support for the indicated standard. If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|2.4GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|b}}, {{enum|g}}, {{enum|n}} are allowed. If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|5GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|a}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ac}} are allowed.

parameter.name: OperatingStandards
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate which IEEE 802.11 standard this {{object}} instance is configured for. Each value indicates support for the indicated standard. If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|2.4GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|b}}, {{enum|g}}, {{enum|n}} are allowed. If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|5GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|a}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ac}} are allowed. For example, a value of "g,b" (or "b,g" - order is not important) means that the 802.11g standard {{bibref|802.11g-2003}} is used with a backwards-compatible mode for 802.11b {{bibref|802.11b-1999}}. A value of "g" means that only the 802.11g standard can be used.

parameter.name: PossibleChannels
parameter.description: {{list}} List items represent possible radio channels for the wireless standard (a, b, g, n) and the regulatory domain. Ranges in the form "n-m" are permitted. For example, for 802.11b and North America, would be "1-11".

parameter.name: ChannelsInUse
parameter.description: {{list}} List items represent channels that the radio determines to be currently in use (including any that it is using itself). Ranges in the form "n-m" are permitted.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The current radio channel used by the connection. To request automatic channel selection, set {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} to {{true}}. Whenever {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} is {{true}}, the value of the {{param}} parameter MUST be the channel selected by the automatic channel selection procedure. Note: Valid {{param}} values depend on the {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} and {{param|RegulatoryDomain}} values specified.

parameter.name: AutoChannelSupported
parameter.description: Indicates whether automatic channel selection is supported by this radio. If {{false}}, then {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} MUST be {{false}}.

parameter.name: AutoChannelEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable automatic channel selection. Set to {{false}} to disable the automatic channel selection procedure, in which case the currently selected channel remains selected. Set to {{true}} to enable the automatic channel selection procedure. This procedure MUST automatically select the channel, and MAY also change it subsequently. {{param}} MUST automatically change to {{false}} whenever the channel is manually selected, i.e. whenever the {{param|Channel}} parameter is written. Whenever {{param}} is {{true}}, the value of the {{param|Channel}} parameter MUST be the channel selected by the automatic channel selection procedure.

parameter.name: AutoChannelRefreshPeriod
parameter.description: The time period in {{units}} between two consecutive automatic channel selections. A value of 0 means that the automatic channel selection is done only at boot time. This parameter is significant only if {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: ChannelLastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the current {{param|Channel}} came into use.

parameter.name: ChannelLastSelectionReason
parameter.description: The cause of the last channel selection.

enumeration.description: Automatic channel selection procedure launched at radio startup.
Automatic channel selection procedure triggered by the user (e.g. via a GUI).
Automatic channel selection procedure triggered by the {{param|AutoChannelRefreshPeriod}} timer.
Automatic channel selection procedure dynamically triggered to adjust to environmental interference.
Automatic channel selection procedure triggered by Dynamic Frequency Selection (DFS) {{bibref|ETSIBRAN}}.

parameter.name: MaxSupportedSSIDs
parameter.description: Maximum number of SSIDs supported on this radio.

parameter.name: MaxSupportedAssociations
parameter.description: Maximum number of associated devices supported.

parameter.name: FirmwareVersion
parameter.description: This radio's WiFi firmware version.

parameter.name: SupportedOperatingChannelBandwidths
parameter.description: {{list}} These are the valid writable values for {{param|OperatingChannelBandwidth}}.

parameter.name: OperatingChannelBandwidth
parameter.description: The preferred channel bandwidth to be used (applicable to 802.11n and 802.11ac specifications only).

parameter.name: CurrentOperatingChannelBandwidth
parameter.description: The channel bandwidth currently in use.

parameter.name: ExtensionChannel
parameter.description: The secondary extension channel position, applicable when operating in wide channel mode (i.e. when {{param|OperatingChannelBandwidth}} is set to {{enum|40MHz|OperatingChannelBandwidth}} or {{enum|Auto|OperatingChannelBandwidth}}).

parameter.name: GuardInterval
parameter.description: The guard interval value between OFDM symbols (applicable to 802.11n and 802.11ac specifications only).

parameter.name: MCS
parameter.description: The Modulation Coding Scheme index (applicable to 802.11n and 802.11ac specifications only). Values from 0 to 15 MUST be supported ({{bibref|802.11n-2009}}). Values from 0 to 9 MUST be supported for {{bibref|802.11ac-2013}}. A value of -1 indicates automatic selection of the MCS index.

parameter.name: TransmitPowerSupported
parameter.description: {{list}} List items represent supported transmit power levels as {{units}} of full power. For example, "0,25,50,75,100". A -1 item indicates auto mode (automatic decision by CPE). Auto mode allows the ''Radio'' to adjust transmit power accordingly. For example, this can be useful for power-save modes such as EU-CoC, where the ''Radio'' can adjust power according to activity in the CPE.

parameter.name: TransmitPower
parameter.description: Indicates the current transmit power level as a {{units}} of full power. The value MUST be one of the values reported by the {{param|TransmitPowerSupported}} parameter. A value of -1 indicates auto mode (automatic decision by CPE).

parameter.name: IEEE80211hSupported
parameter.description: Indicates whether IEEE 802.11h {{bibref|802.11h-2003}} functionality is supported by this radio. The value can be {{true}} only if the 802.11a or the 802.11n@5GHz standard is supported (i.e. {{param|SupportedFrequencyBands}} includes {{enum|5GHz|SupportedFrequencyBands}} and {{param|SupportedStandards}} includes {{enum|a|SupportedStandards}} and/or {{enum|n|SupportedStandards}}).

parameter.name: IEEE80211hEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether IEEE 802.11h functionality is enabled on this radio. The value can be {{true}} only if the 802.11a or the 802.11n@5GHz standard is supported and enabled (i.e. {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is {{enum|5GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}} and {{param|OperatingStandards}} includes {{enum|a|OperatingStandards}} and/or {{enum|n|OperatingStandards}}).

parameter.name: RegulatoryDomain
parameter.description: The 802.11d Regulatory Domain. First two octets are {{bibref|ISO3166-1}} two-character country code. The third octet is either " " (all environments), "O" (outside) or "I" (inside).

parameter.name: RetryLimit
parameter.description: The maximum number of retransmissions of a short packet i.e. a packet that is no longer than the {{param|RTSThreshold}}. This corresponds to IEEE 802.11 parameter ''dot11ShortRetryLimit'' {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: CCARequest
parameter.description: A request for the clear channel assessment (CCA) report in the format specified in {{bibref|802.11-2012|Clause 8.4.2.23.3}}.

parameter.name: CCAReport
parameter.description: The clear channel assessment (CCA) report in the format specified in {{bibref|802.11-2012|Clause 8.4.2.24.3}}. When read, the value of this parameter MUST correspond to {{param|CCARequest}}. How this is achieved is a local matter to the CPE. If this parameter is read before a CCARequest has been issued, then its value is {{empty}}.

parameter.name: RPIHistogramRequest
parameter.description: A request for a received power indicator (RPI) histogram in the format specified in {{bibref|802.11-2012|Clause 8.4.2.23.4}}.

parameter.name: RPIHistogramReport
parameter.description: Received power indicator (RPI) histogram report in the format specified in {{bibref|802.11-2012|Clause 8.4.2.24.4}}.

parameter.name: FragmentationThreshold
parameter.description: This specifies the current maximum size, in {{units}}, of the MPDU that can be delivered to the PHY. This parameter is based on ''dot11FragmentationThreshold'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: RTSThreshold
parameter.description: This indicates the number of {{units}} in an MPDU, below which an RTS/CTS handshake is not performed. This parameter is based on ''dot11RTSThreshold'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: LongRetryLimit
parameter.description: This indicates the maximum number of transmission attempts of a frame, the length of which is greater than {{param|RTSThreshold}}, that will be made before a failure condition is indicated. This parameter is based on ''dot11LongRetryLimit'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: BeaconPeriod
parameter.description: Time interval between transmitting beacons (expressed in {{units}}). This parameter is based on ''dot11BeaconPeriod'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: DTIMPeriod
