parameter.description: This specifies the number of beacon intervals that elapse between transmission of Beacon frames containing a TIM element whose DTIM Count field is 0. This parameter is based on ''dot11DTIMPeriod'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: PacketAggregationEnable
parameter.description: This determines whether or not packet aggregation (commonly called "frame aggregation") is enabled. This applies only to 802.11n.

parameter.name: PreambleType
parameter.description: The type of preamble. Longer preambles (more overhead) are needed by 802.11g to coexist with legacy systems 802.11 and 802.11b.

parameter.name: BasicDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: {{list}} The set of data rates, in ''Mbps'', that have to be supported by all stations that desire to join this BSS. The stations have to be able to receive and transmit at each of the data rates listed in {{param}}. For example, a value of "1,2", indicates that stations support 1 Mbps and 2 Mbps. Most control packets use a data rate in {{param}}.

parameter.name: OperationalDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: {{list}} Maximum access point data transmit rates in ''Mbps'' for unicast frames (a superset of {{param|BasicDataTransmitRates}}). Given the value of {{param|BasicDataTransmitRates}} from the example above, {{param}} might be "1,2,5.5,11", indicating that unicast frames can additionally be transmitted at 5.5 Mbps and 11 Mbps.

parameter.name: SupportedDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: {{list}} Data transmit rates in ''Mbps'' for unicast frames at which the access point will permit a station to connect (a subset of {{param|OperationalDataTransmitRates}}). Given the values of {{param|BasicDataTransmitRates}} and {{param|OperationalDataTransmitRates}} from the examples above, {{param}} might be "1,2,5.5", indicating that the AP will only permit connections at 1 Mbps, 2 Mbps and 5.5 Mbps, even though it could theoretically accept connections at 11 Mbps.

object.name: Device.WiFi.Radio.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. Packet counters here count 802.11 WiFi frames. See {{bibref|TR-181i2a5|Appendix III}} for further details. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2a5|Section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: PLCPErrorCount
parameter.description: The number of packets that were received with a detected Physical Layer Convergence Protocol (PLCP) header error.

parameter.name: FCSErrorCount
parameter.description: The number of packets that were received with a detected FCS error. This parameter is based on dot11FCSErrorCount from {{bibref|802.11-2012|Annex C}}.

parameter.name: InvalidMACCount
parameter.description: The number of packets that were received with a detected invalid MAC header error.

parameter.name: PacketsOtherReceived
parameter.description: The number of packets that were received, but which were destined for a MAC address that is not associated with this interface.

parameter.name: Noise
parameter.description: An indicator of average noise strength received at this radio, measured in {{units}}. This measurement of non-IEEE 802.11 noise power is made by sampling the channel when virtual carrier sense indicates idle and this radio is neither transmitting nor receiving a frame.

parameter.name: TotalChannelChangeCount
parameter.description: The total number of times that the {{param|#.Channel}} has changed since the {{object|.WiFi.Radio}} entered its current operating state.

parameter.name: ManualChannelChangeCount
parameter.description: The number of times that the {{param|#.Channel}} has changed due to manual channel selection since the {{object|.WiFi.Radio}} entered its current operating state.

parameter.name: AutoStartupChannelChangeCount
parameter.description: The number of times that the {{param|#.Channel}} has changed due to automatic channel selection procedure launched at radio startup since the {{object|.WiFi.Radio}} entered its current operating state.

parameter.name: AutoUserChannelChangeCount
parameter.description: The number of times that the {{param|#.Channel}} has changed due to automatic channel selection procedure triggered by the user (e.g. via a GUI) since the {{object|.WiFi.Radio}} entered its current operating state.

parameter.name: AutoRefreshChannelChangeCount
parameter.description: The number of times that the {{param|#.Channel}} has changed due to automatic channel selection procedure triggered by the {{param|#.AutoChannelRefreshPeriod}} timer since the {{object|.WiFi.Radio}} entered its current operating state.

parameter.name: AutoDynamicChannelChangeCount
parameter.description: The number of times that the {{param|#.Channel}} has changed due to automatic channel selection procedure dynamically triggered to adjust to environmental interference since the {{object|.WiFi.Radio}} entered its current operating state.

parameter.name: AutoDFSChannelChangeCount
parameter.description: The number of times that the {{param|#.Channel}} has changed due to automatic channel selection procedure triggered by DFS {{bibref|ETSIBRAN}} since the {{object|.WiFi.Radio}} entered its current operating state.

object.name: Device.WiFi.NeighboringWiFiDiagnostic.
object.description: This object defines access to other WiFi SSIDs that this device is able to receive.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: ResultNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.NeighboringWiFiDiagnostic.Result.{i}.
object.description: Neighboring SSID table. This table models the other WiFi SSIDs that this device is able to receive.

parameter.name: Radio
parameter.description: The Radio that detected the neighboring WiFi SSID.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The current service set identifier in use by the neighboring WiFi SSID. The value MAY be empty for hidden SSIDs.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The BSSID used for the neighboring WiFi SSID.

parameter.name: Mode
parameter.description: The mode the neighboring WiFi radio is operating in.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The current radio channel used by the neighboring WiFi radio.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description: An indicator of radio signal strength (RSSI) of the neighboring WiFi radio measured in {{units}}, as an average of the last 100 packets received.

parameter.name: SecurityModeEnabled
parameter.description: The type of encryption the neighboring WiFi SSID advertises.

parameter.name: EncryptionMode
parameter.description: The type of encryption the neighboring WiFi SSID advertises.

parameter.name: OperatingFrequencyBand
parameter.description: Indicates the frequency band at which the radio this SSID instance is operating.

parameter.name: SupportedStandards
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate which IEEE 802.11 standards this {{object}} instance can support simultaneously, in the frequency band specified by {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}}. {{enum}} Each value indicates support for the indicated standard. If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|2.4GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|b}}, {{enum|g}}, {{enum|n}} are allowed. If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|5GHz|OperatingFrequencyBand}}, only values {{enum|a}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ac}} are allowed.

parameter.name: OperatingStandards
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate which IEEE 802.11 standard that is detected for this {{object}}. Each value indicates support for the indicated standard. If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|2.4GHz|##.Radio.{i}.SupportedFrequencyBands}}, only values {{enum|b}}, {{enum|g}}, {{enum|n}} are allowed. If {{param|OperatingFrequencyBand}} is set to {{enum|5GHz|##.Radio.{i}.SupportedFrequencyBands}}, only values {{enum|a}}, {{enum|n}}, {{enum|ac}} are allowed. For example, a value of "g,b" (or "b,g" - order is not important) means that the 802.11g standard {{bibref|802.11g-2003}} is used with a backwards-compatible mode for 802.11b {{bibref|802.11b-1999}}. A value of "g" means that only the 802.11g standard can be used.

parameter.name: OperatingChannelBandwidth
parameter.description: Indicates the bandwidth at which the channel is operating.

parameter.name: BeaconPeriod
parameter.description: Time interval (in {{units}}) between transmitting beacons.

parameter.name: Noise
parameter.description: Indicator of average noise strength (in {{units}}) received from the neighboring WiFi radio.

parameter.name: BasicDataTransferRates
parameter.description: {{list}} Basic data transmit rates (in Mbps) for the SSID. For example, if {{param}} is "1,2", this indicates that the SSID is operating with basic rates of 1 Mbps and 2 Mbps.

parameter.name: SupportedDataTransferRates
parameter.description: {{list}} Data transmit rates (in Mbps) for unicast frames at which the SSID will permit a station to connect. For example, if {{param}} is "1,2,5.5", this indicates that the SSID will only permit connections at 1 Mbps, 2 Mbps and 5.5 Mbps.

parameter.name: DTIMPeriod
parameter.description: The number of beacon intervals that elapse between transmission of Beacon frames containing a TIM element whose DTIM count field is 0. This value is transmitted in the DTIM Period field of beacon frames. {{bibref|802.11-2012}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.
object.description: WiFi SSID table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}), where table entries model the MAC layer. A WiFi SSID entry is typically stacked on top of a {{object|#.Radio}} object. WiFi SSID is also a multiplexing layer, i.e. more than one {{object}} can be stacked above a single {{object|#.Radio}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the SSID entry. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the SSID entry (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the SSID entry as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the SSID entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The Basic Service Set ID. This is the MAC address of the access point, which can either be local (when this instance models an access point SSID) or remote (when this instance models an end point SSID).

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of this interface. If this instance models an access point SSID, {{param}} is the same as {{param||BSSID}}. Note: This is not necessarily the same as the Ethernet header source or destination MAC address, which is associated with the IP interface and is modeled via the {{param|.Ethernet.Link.{i}.MACAddress}} parameter.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The current service set identifier in use by the connection. The SSID is an identifier that is attached to packets sent over the wireless LAN that functions as an ID for joining a particular radio network (BSS).

parameter.name: Upstream
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interface points towards the Internet ({{true}}) or towards End Devices ({{false}}). For example: * For an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all WAN interfaces and {{false}} for all LAN interfaces. * For a standalone WiFi Access Point that is connected via Ethernet to an Internet Gateway Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for the Ethernet interface and {{false}} for the WiFi Radio interface. * For an End Device, {{param}} will be {{true}} for all interfaces. This parameter supersedes the deprecated {{param|#.Radio.{i}.Upstream}} parameter. If both exist, the parameter {{param|#.Radio.{i}.Upstream}} is ignored.

object.name: Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. Packet counters here count 802.11 WiFi frames. See {{bibref|TR-181i2a5|Appendix III}} for further details. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2a5|Section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. These can be due to the number of retransmissions exceeding the retry limit, or from other causes.

parameter.name: RetransCount
parameter.description: The total number of transmitted packets which were retransmissions. Two retransmissions of the same packet results in this counter incrementing by two.

parameter.name: FailedRetransCount
parameter.description: The number of packets that were not transmitted successfully due to the number of retransmission attempts exceeding an 802.11 retry limit. This parameter is based on dot11FailedCount from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: RetryCount
parameter.description: The number of packets that were successfully transmitted after one or more retransmissions. This parameter is based on dot11RetryCount from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: MultipleRetryCount
parameter.description: The number of packets that were successfully transmitted after more than one retransmission. This parameter is based on dot11MultipleRetryCount from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: ACKFailureCount
parameter.description: The number of expected ACKs that were never received. This parameter is based on dot11ACKFailureCount from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: AggregatedPacketCount
parameter.description: The number of aggregated packets that were transmitted. This applies only to 802.11n and 802.11ac.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

object.name: Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.
object.description: This object models an 802.11 connection from the perspective of a wireless access point. Each {{object}} entry is associated with a particular {{object|#.SSID}} interface instance via the {{param|SSIDReference}} parameter. For enabled table entries, if {{param|SSIDReference}} is not a valid reference then the table entry is inoperable and the CPE MUST set {{param|Status}} to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|Status}}. Note: The {{object}} table includes a unique key parameter that is a strong reference. If a strongly referenced object is deleted, the CPE will set the referencing parameter to {{empty}}. However, doing so under these circumstances might cause the updated {{object}} row to then violate the table's unique key constraint; if this occurs, the CPE MUST set {{param|Status}} to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|Status}} and disable the offending {{object}} row.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this access point.

parameter.name: Status
Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: SSIDReference
parameter.description: {{reference}}

parameter.name: SSIDAdvertisementEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not beacons include the SSID name.

parameter.name: RetryLimit
parameter.description: The maximum number of retransmission for a packet. This corresponds to IEEE 802.11 parameter ''dot11ShortRetryLimit''. This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is really a {{object|#.Radio}} attribute. Use {{param|#.Radio.{i}.RetryLimit}}.

parameter.name: WMMCapability
parameter.description: Indicates whether this access point supports WiFi Multimedia (WMM) Access Categories (AC).

parameter.name: UAPSDCapability
parameter.description: Indicates whether this access point supports WMM Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery (U-APSD). Note: U-APSD support implies WMM support.

parameter.name: WMMEnable
parameter.description: Whether WMM support is currently enabled. When enabled, this is indicated in beacon frames.

parameter.name: UAPSDEnable
parameter.description: Whether U-APSD support is currently enabled. When enabled, this is indicated in beacon frames. Note: U-APSD can only be enabled if WMM is also enabled.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: MaxAssociatedDevices
parameter.description: The maximum number of devices that can simultaneously be connected to the access point. A value of 0 means that there is no specific limit.

parameter.name: IsolationEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables device isolation. A value of {{true}} means that the devices connected to the Access Point are isolated from all other devices within the home network (as is typically the case for a Wireless Hotspot).

parameter.name: MACAddressControlEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not MAC Address Control is enabled on this {{object|#}}. MAC Address Control limits client devices to those whose hardware addresses match the {{param|AllowedMACAddress}} list.

parameter.name: AllowedMACAddress
parameter.description: Hardware addresses of client devices that are allowed to associate with this {{object|#}} if {{param|MACAddressControlEnabled}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: MaxAllowedAssociations
parameter.description: Maximum number of associated devices allowed for this SSID. If the number is reached new device connections to this access point will be rejected. If the number is changed to a value less than the actual number of associated devices, new device connections will be rejected until the number of devices is below this number. It is not expected that any connections are dropped. If the parameter {{param|#.Radio.{i}.MaxSupportedAssociations}} exists, the value MUST be less than or equal to the maximum number specified in {{param|#.Radio.{i}.MaxSupportedAssociations}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.Security.
object.description: This object contains security related parameters that apply to a CPE acting as an Access Point {{bibref|802.11-2007}}.

parameter.name: ModesSupported
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates which security modes this {{object|#}} instance is capable of supporting.

parameter.name: ModeEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates which security mode is enabled.

parameter.name: WEPKey
parameter.description: A WEP key expressed as a hexadecimal string. {{param}} is used only if {{param|ModeEnabled}} is set to {{enum|WEP-64|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WEP-128|ModeEnabled}}. A 5 byte {{param}} corresponds to security mode {{enum|WEP-64|ModeEnabled}} and a 13 byte {{param}} corresponds to security mode {{enum|WEP-128|ModeEnabled}}.

parameter.name: PreSharedKey
parameter.description: A literal PreSharedKey (PSK) expressed as a hexadecimal string. {{param}} is only used if {{param|ModeEnabled}} is set to {{enum|WPA-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}}. If {{param|KeyPassphrase}} is written, then {{param}} is immediately generated. The ACS SHOULD NOT set both the {{param|KeyPassphrase}} and the {{param}} directly (the result of doing this is undefined).

parameter.name: KeyPassphrase
parameter.description: A passphrase from which the {{param|PreSharedKey}} is to be generated, for {{enum|WPA-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}} security modes. If {{param}} is written, then {{param|PreSharedKey}} is immediately generated. The ACS SHOULD NOT set both the {{param}} and the {{param|PreSharedKey}} directly (the result of doing this is undefined). The key is generated as specified by WPA, which uses PBKDF2 from PKCS #5: Password-based Cryptography Specification Version 2.0 ({{bibref|RFC2898}}).

parameter.name: RekeyingInterval
parameter.description: The interval (expressed in {{units}}) in which the keys are re-generated. This is applicable to WPA, WPA2 and Mixed (WPA-WPA2) modes in Personal or Enterprise mode (i.e. when {{param|ModeEnabled}} is set to a value other than {{enum|None|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WEP-64|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WEP-128|ModeEnabled}}.

parameter.name: RadiusServerIPAddr
parameter.description: The IP Address of the RADIUS server used for WLAN security. {{param}} is only applicable when {{param|ModeEnabled}} is an Enterprise type (i.e. {{enum|WPA-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}, {{enum|WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}).

parameter.name: SecondaryRadiusServerIPAddr
parameter.description: The IP Address of a secondary RADIUS server used for WLAN security. {{param}} is only applicable when {{param|ModeEnabled}} is an Enterprise type (i.e. {{enum|WPA-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}, {{enum|WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}). The client can forward requests to the secondary server in the event that the primary server is down or unreachable, or after a number of tries to the primary server fail, or in a round-robin fashion {{bibref|RFC2865}}.

parameter.name: RadiusServerPort
parameter.description: The port number of the RADIUS server used for WLAN security. {{param}} is only applicable when {{param|ModeEnabled}} is an Enterprise type (i.e. {{enum|WPA-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}, {{enum|WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}).

parameter.name: SecondaryRadiusServerPort
parameter.description: The port number of the secondary RADIUS server used for WLAN security. {{param}} is only applicable when {{param|ModeEnabled}} is an Enterprise type (i.e. {{enum|WPA-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}, {{enum|WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}). If this parameter is not implemented, the secondary RADIUS server will use the same port number as the primary RADIUS server.

parameter.name: RadiusSecret
parameter.description: The secret used for handshaking with the RADIUS server {{bibref|RFC2865}}.

parameter.name: SecondaryRadiusSecret
parameter.description: The secret used for handshaking with the secondary RADIUS server {{bibref|RFC2865}}. If this parameter is not implemented, the secondary RADIUS server will use the same secret as the primary RADIUS server.

parameter.name: MFPConfig
parameter.description: Management Frame Protection configuration applicable when {{param|ModeEnabled}} is set to {{enum|WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}.

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, this {{object|#}} instance's WiFi security settings are reset to their factory default values. The affected settings include {{param|ModeEnabled}}, {{param|WEPKey}}, {{param|PreSharedKey}} , {{param|KeyPassphrase}} and {{param|#.WPS.PIN}} (if applicable). If the parameter cannot be set, the CPE MUST reject the request as an invalid parameter value. Possible failure reasons include a lack of default values or if {{param|ModeEnabled}} is an Enterprise type, i.e. {{enum|WPA-Enterprise|ModesSupported}}, {{enum|WPA2-Enterprise|ModesSupported}} or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Enterprise|ModesSupported}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.WPS.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to Wi-Fi Protected Setup for this access point (as specified in {{bibref|WPSv1.0}} or {bibref|WPSv2.0}}).

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables WPS functionality for this access point.

parameter.name: ConfigMethodsSupported
ConfigMethodsEnabled
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates WPS configuration methods enabled on the device.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the current status of WPS. If the device goes to {{enum|SetupLocked}} the WPS needs to be disabled and re-enabled to come out of state.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: The Wi-Fi Simple Configuration version supported by the device, a string of the form ''m.n'' where ''m'' is the major version and ''n'' is the minor version. For example, a value of ''1.0'' denotes WSC 1.0 and a value of ''2.0'' denotes WSC 2.0.

parameter.name: PIN
parameter.description: Represents the Device PIN used for PIN based pairing between WPS peers. This PIN is either a four digit number or an eight digit number. {{hidden}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.
object.description: A table of the devices currently associated with the access point.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of an associated device.

parameter.name: OperatingStandard
parameter.description: The operating standard that this associated device is connected with.

parameter.name: AuthenticationState
parameter.description: Whether an associated device has authenticated ({{true}}) or not ({{false}}).

parameter.name: LastDataDownlinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission from the access point to the associated device.

parameter.name: LastDataUplinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission from the associated device to the access point.

parameter.name: AssociationTime
parameter.description: Date and time in UTC when the device was associated

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description: An indicator of radio signal strength of the uplink from the associated device to the access point, measured in {{units}}, as an average of the last 100 packets received from the device.

parameter.name: Noise
parameter.description: An indicator of radio noise on the uplink from the associated device to the access point, measured in {{units}}, as an average of the last 100 packets received from the device (see ANPI definition in {{bibref|802.11-2012|Clause 10.11.9.4}})

parameter.name: Retransmissions
parameter.description: The number of {{units}} that had to be re-transmitted, from the last 100 packets sent to the associated device. Multiple re-transmissions of the same packet count as one.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.description: Whether or not this node is currently present in the WiFi AccessPoint network. The ability to list inactive nodes is OPTIONAL. If the CPE includes inactive nodes in this table, {{param}} MUST be set to {{false}} for each inactive node. The length of time an inactive node remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

object.name: Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.Stats.
object.description: These count bytes or packets sent to, or received from, this Associated Device, which is a WiFi station associated to this access point. Packet counters here count 802.11 WiFi frames. The CPE MUST reset these {{object}} parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the {{param|##.Status}} of the parent {{object|##}} object transitions from {{enum|Disabled|##.Status}} to {{enum|Enabled|##.Status}}, or when it transitions from {{enum|Enabled|##.Status}} to {{enum|Disabled|##.Status}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted to the Associated Device, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received from the Associated Device, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted to the Associated Device.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received from the Associated Device.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. These might be due to the number of retransmissions exceeding the retry limit, or from other causes.

parameter.name: RetransCount
parameter.description: The total number of transmitted packets which were retransmissions. Two retransmissions of the same packet results in this counter incrementing by two.

parameter.name: FailedRetransCount
parameter.description: The number of packets that were not transmitted successfully due to the number of retransmission attempts exceeding an 802.11 retry limit. This parameter is based on ''dot11FailedCount'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: RetryCount
parameter.description: The number of packets that were successfully transmitted after one or more retransmissions. This parameter is based on ''dot11RetryCount'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

parameter.name: MultipleRetryCount
parameter.description: The number of packets that were successfully transmitted after more than one retransmission. This parameter is based on ''dot11MultipleRetryCount'' from {{bibref|802.11-2012}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AC.{i}.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to WiFi QoS for different 802.11e access categories (priorities). Access categories are: BE, BK, VI, and VO. These parameters can help control and monitor 802.11e Enhanced distributed channel access (EDCA). The size of this table is fixed, with four entries which are identified by the {{param|AccessCategory}} parameter as follows: * BE (Best Effort) * BK (Background) * VI (Video) * VO (Voice)

parameter.name: AccessCategory
parameter.description: This identifies the access category.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: AIFSN
parameter.description: Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing (Number). This is the number of time slots in the arbitration interframe space.

parameter.name: ECWMin
parameter.description: Exponent of Contention Window (Minimum). This encodes the values of CWMin as an exponent: CWMin = 2^ECWMin - 1. For example, if ECWMin is 8, then CWMin is 2^8 - 1, or 255, (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: ECWMax
parameter.description: Exponent of Contention Window (Maximum). This encodes the values of CWMax as an exponent: CWMax = 2^ECWMax - 1. For example, if ECWMax is 8, then CWMax is 2^8 - 1, or 255, (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: TxOpMax
parameter.description: Maximum transmit opportunity, in multiples of {{units}}. A TXOP time interval of 0 means it is limited to a single MAC protocol data unit (MPDU).

parameter.name: AckPolicy
parameter.description: Ack Policy, where False="Do Not Acknowledge" and True="Acknowledge"

parameter.name: OutQLenHistogramIntervals
parameter.description: {{list}} Definition of the histogram intervals for counting the transmit queue length in packets. Each value indicates the maximum value of the interval. For example, "0,1,4,8," defines the five intervals: 0 packets in queue, 1 packet in queue, 2 to 4 packets in queue, 5 to 8 packets in queue, and 9 or more packets in queue. (No value after the last comma means no upper bound.) If this parameter is set to {{empty}}, no {{param|Stats.OutQLenHistogram}} stats will be collected.

parameter.name: OutQLenHistogramSampleInterval
parameter.description: The time between recording samples of the current transmit queue in {{units}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AC.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for different 802.11e access categories (priorities). Packet counters here count 802.11 WiFi frames. If there are not separate stats for each access category, (e.g., 802.11e is not used and there is only one queue), then only access category 0 = BE applies (e.g., the statistics for the single queue are in access category 0 = BE). The CPE MUST reset the Access Point's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the Access Point becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the Access Point's Status parameter transitions to a Diasbled state) or when the Access Point becomes administratively up (i.e. the Access Point's Enable parameter transitions from false to true). Administrative and operational status is discussed in [Section 4.2.2/TR-181i2].

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} transmitted in this access category, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received in this access category, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} transmitted in this access category.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received in this access category.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound {{units}} in this access category that could not be transmitted because of errors. These might be due to the number of retransmissions exceeding the retry limit, or from other causes.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound {{units}} in this access category that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound {{units}} in this access category which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound {{units}} in this access category which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: RetransCount
parameter.description: The total number of transmitted {{units}} in this access category which were retransmissions. Two retransmissions of the same packet results in this counter incrementing by two.

parameter.name: OutQLenHistogram
parameter.description: {{list}} Histogram of the total length of the transmit queue of this access category in packets (1 packet, 2 packets, etc.) according to the intervals defined by {{param|#.OutQLenHistogramIntervals}}, with samples taken each {{param|#.OutQLenHistogramSampleInterval}}. Example: "12,5,1,0,2,0,0,1".

object.name: Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.Accounting.
object.description: This object contains the parameters related to RADIUS accounting functionality for the access point.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables accounting functionality for the access point.

parameter.name: ServerIPAddr
parameter.description: The IP Address of the RADIUS accounting server.

parameter.name: SecondaryServerIPAddr
parameter.description: The IP Address of a secondary RADIUS accounting server. The client can forward requests to the secondary server in the event that the primary server is down or unreachable, or after a number of tries to the primary server fail, or in a round-robin fashion. {{bibref|RFC2866}}

parameter.name: ServerPort
parameter.description: The port number of the RADIUS server used for accounting. The default port is 1813 as defined in {{bibref|RFC2866}}.

parameter.name: SecondaryServerPort
parameter.description: The port number of the secondary RADIUS server used for accounting. The default port is 1813 as defined in {{bibref|RFC2866}}. If this parameter is not implemented, the secondary RADIUS server will use the same port number as the primary RADIUS server.

parameter.name: Secret
parameter.description: The secret used for handshaking with the RADIUS accounting server {{bibref|RFC2865}}.

parameter.name: SecondarySecret
parameter.description: The secret used for handshaking with the secondary RADIUS accounting server {{bibref|RFC2865}}. If this parameter is not implemented, the secondary RADIUS server will use the same secret as the primary RADIUS server.

parameter.name: InterimInterval

object.name: Device.WiFi.EndPoint.{i}.
object.description: This object models an 802.11 connection from the perspective of a wireless end point. Each {{object}} entry is associated with a particular {{object|#.SSID}} interface instance via the {{param|SSIDReference}} parameter, and an associated active {{object|Profile}} instance via the {{param|ProfileReference}} parameter. The active profile is responsible for specifying the actual SSID and security settings used by the end point. For enabled table entries, if {{param|SSIDReference}} or {{param|ProfileReference}} is not a valid reference then the table entry is inoperable and the CPE MUST set {{param|Status}} to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|Status}}. Note: The {{object}} table includes a unique key parameter that is a strong reference. If a strongly referenced object is deleted, the CPE will set the referencing parameter to {{empty}}. However, doing so under these circumstances might cause the updated {{object}} row to then violate the table's unique key constraint; if this occurs, the CPE MUST set {{param|Status}} to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|Status}} and disable the offending {{object}} row.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this end point.

parameter.name: Status
Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: ProfileReference
parameter.description: {{reference}} This is the currently active profile, which specifies the SSID and security settings to be used by the end point.

parameter.name: SSIDReference
parameter.description: {{reference}} {{param}} is determined based on the {{param|Profile.{i}.SSID}} within the associated {{param|ProfileReference}}) endpoint profile. {{param}} MUST be {{empty}} if {{param|ProfileReference}} is {{empty}} (i.e. only when an active profile is assigned can the associated SSID interface be determined).

parameter.name: ProfileNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.EndPoint.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this end point.

parameter.name: LastDataDownlinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission from the access point to the end point device.

parameter.name: LastDataUplinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission from the end point to the access point device.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description: An indicator of radio signal strength of the downlink from the access point to the end point, measured in {{units}}, as an average of the last 100 packets received from the device.

parameter.name: Retransmissions
parameter.description: The number of {{units}} that had to be re-transmitted, from the last 100 packets sent to the access point. Multiple re-transmissions of the same packet count as one.

object.name: Device.WiFi.EndPoint.{i}.Security.
object.description: This object contains security related parameters that apply to a WiFi end point {{bibref|802.11-2007}}.

parameter.name: ModesSupported
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates which security modes this {{object|#}} instance is capable of supporting.

object.name: Device.WiFi.EndPoint.{i}.Profile.{i}.
object.description: EndPoint Profile table.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this Profile. When there are multiple WiFi EndPoint Profiles, e.g. each instance supports a different SSID and/or different security configuration, this parameter can be used to control which of the instances are currently enabled.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this Profile. {{enum}} The {{enum|Active}} value is reserved for the instance that is actively connected. The {{enum|Available}} value represents an instance that is not currently active, but is also not disabled or in error. The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The profile identifier in use by the connection. The SSID is an identifier that is attached to packets sent over the wireless LAN that functions as an ID for joining a particular radio network (BSS).

parameter.name: Location
parameter.description: Location of the profile. This value serves as a reminder from the user, describing the location of the profile. For example: "Home", "Office", "Neighbor House", "Airport", etc. An empty string is also valid.

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.description: The profile Priority defines one of the criteria used by the End Point to automatically select the "best" AP when several APs with known profiles are simultaneously available for association. In this situation, the End Point has to select the AP with the higher priority in its profile. If there are several APs with the same priority, providing different SSID or the same SSID, then the wireless end point has to select the APs according to other criteria like signal quality, SNR, etc. 0 is the highest priority.

object.name: Device.WiFi.EndPoint.{i}.Profile.{i}.Security.
object.description: This object contains security related parameters that apply to a WiFi End Point profile {{bibref|802.11-2007}}.

parameter.name: ModeEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates which security mode is enabled.

parameter.name: WEPKey
parameter.description: A WEP key expressed as a hexadecimal string. {{param}} is used only if {{param|ModeEnabled}} is set to {{enum|WEP-64|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WEP-128|ModeEnabled}}. A 5 byte {{param}} corresponds to security mode {{enum|WEP-64|ModeEnabled}} and a 13 byte {{param}} corresponds to security mode {{enum|WEP-128|ModeEnabled}}.

parameter.name: PreSharedKey
parameter.description: A literal PreSharedKey (PSK) expressed as a hexadecimal string. {{param}} is only used if {{param|ModeEnabled}} is set to {{enum|WPA-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}}. If {{param|KeyPassphrase}} is written, then {{param}} is immediately generated. The ACS SHOULD NOT set both the {{param|KeyPassphrase}} and the {{param}} directly (the result of doing this is undefined).

parameter.name: KeyPassphrase
parameter.description: A passphrase from which the {{param|PreSharedKey}} is to be generated, for {{enum|WPA-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA-WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}} security modes. If {{param}} is written, then {{param|PreSharedKey}} is immediately generated. The ACS SHOULD NOT set both the {{param}} and the {{param|PreSharedKey}} directly (the result of doing this is undefined). The key is generated as specified by WPA, which uses PBKDF2 from PKCS #5: Password-based Cryptography Specification Version 2.0 {{bibref|RFC2898}}.

parameter.name: MFPConfig
parameter.description: Management Frame Protection configuration applicable when {{param|ModeEnabled}} is set to {{enum|WPA2-Personal|ModeEnabled}} or {{enum|WPA2-Enterprise|ModeEnabled}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.EndPoint.{i}.WPS.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to Wi-Fi Protected Setup {{bibref|WPSv1.0}} for this end point.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables WPS functionality for this end point.

parameter.name: ConfigMethodsSupported
ConfigMethodsEnabled
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the WPS configuration methods enabled on the device.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the current status of WPS in EndPoint.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: The Wi-Fi Simple Configuration version supported by the device, a string of the form ''m.n'' where ''m'' is the major version and ''n'' is the minor version. For example, a value of ''1.0'' denotes WSC 1.0 and a value of ''2.0'' denotes WSC 2.0.

parameter.name: PIN
parameter.description: Represents the Device PIN used for PIN based pairing between WPS peers. This PIN is either a four digit number or an eight digit number. {{hidden}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.EndPoint.{i}.AC.{i}.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to WiFi QoS for different 802.11e access categories (priorities). Access categories are: BE, BK, VI, and VO. These parameters can help control and monitor 802.11e Enhanced distributed channel access (EDCA). The size of this table is fixed, with four entries which are identified by the {{param|AccessCategory}} parameter as follows: * BE (Best Effort) * BK (Background) * VI (Video) * VO (Voice)

parameter.name: AccessCategory
parameter.description: This identifies the access category.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: AIFSN
parameter.description: Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing (Number). This is the number of time slots in the arbitration interframe space.

parameter.name: ECWMin
parameter.description: Exponent of Contention Window (Minimum). This encodes the values of CWMin as an exponent: CWMin = 2^ECWMin - 1. For example, if ECWMin is 8, then CWMin is 2^8 - 1, or 255, (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: ECWMax
parameter.description: Exponent of Contention Window (Maximum). This encodes the values of CWMax as an exponent: CWMax = 2^ECWMax - 1. For example, if ECWMax is 8, then CWMax is 2^8 - 1, or 255, (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: TxOpMax
parameter.description: Maximum transmit opportunity, in multiples of {{units}}. A TXOP time interval of 0 means it is limited to a single MAC protocol data unit (MPDU).

parameter.name: AckPolicy
parameter.description: Ack Policy, where False="Do Not Acknowledge" and True="Acknowledge"

parameter.name: OutQLenHistogramIntervals
parameter.description: {{list}} Definition of the histogram intervals for counting the transmit queue length in packets. Each value indicates the maximum value of the interval. For example, "0,1,4,8," defines the five intervals: 0 packets in queue, 1 packet in queue, 2 to 4 packets in queue, 5 to 8 packets in queue, and 9 or more packets in queue. (No value after the last comma means no upper bound.) If this parameter is set to an empty string, no {{param|Stats.OutQLenHistogram}} stats will be collected.

parameter.name: OutQLenHistogramSampleInterval
parameter.description: The time between recording samples of the current transmit queue {{units}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.EndPoint.{i}.AC.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for different 802.11e access categories (priorities). Packet counters here count 802.11 WiFi frames. If there are not separate stats for each access category, (e.g., 802.11e is not used and there is only one queue), then only access category 0 = BE applies (e.g., the statistics for the single queue are in access category 0 = BE). The CPE MUST reset the EndPoint's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the EndPoint becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the EndPoint's Status parameter transitions to a Diasbled state) or when the EndPoint becomes administratively up (i.e. the EndPoint's Enable parameter transitions from false to true). Administrative and operational status is discussed in [Section 4.2.2/TR-181i2].

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} transmitted in this access category, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received in this access category, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} transmitted in this access category.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received in this access category.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound {{units}} in this access category that could not be transmitted because of errors. These might be due to the number of retransmissions exceeding the retry limit, or from other causes.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound {{units}} in this access category that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound {{units}} in this access category which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound {{units}} in this access category which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: RetransCount
parameter.description: The total number of transmitted {{units}} in this access category which were retransmissions. Two retransmissions of the same packet results in this counter incrementing by two.

parameter.name: OutQLenHistogram
parameter.description: {{list}} Histogram of the total length of the transmit queue of this access category in packets (1 packet, 2 packets, etc.) according to the intervals defined by {{param|#.OutQLenHistogramIntervals}}, with samples taken each {{param|#.OutQLenHistogramSampleInterval}}. Example: "12,5,1,0,2,0,0,1"

object.name: Device.ZigBee.
object.description: Top level object for ZigBee capabilities based on the {{bibref|ZigBee2007}} specification.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ZDONumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.ZigBee.Interface.{i}.
object.description: ZigBee interface table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). This table models the ZigBee interface of a ZigBee end device, ZigBee router or ZigBee coordinator.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the interface. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}} When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface). When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason. This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.

parameter.name: IEEEAddress
parameter.description: The IEEE address assigned to this interface. A value of "FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF" indicates that this address is unknown. This parameter has the same value as the {{param|.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.IEEEAddress}} parameter of the ZDO instance {{param|ZDOReference}} is pointing to.

parameter.name: NetworkAddress
parameter.description: The ZigBee network address assigned to this interface. This parameter has the same value as the {{param|.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.NetworkAddress}} parameter of the ZDO instance {{param|ZDOReference}} is pointing to.

parameter.name: ZDOReference
parameter.description: The ZigBee Device Object assigned to this interface.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.ZigBee.Interface.{i}.Stats.
object.description: Throughput statistics for this interface. The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} sent transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received by the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} discarded by interface due to any error.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} requested for transmission which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent the {{units}} being transmitted.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} requested for transmission which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer and delivered by this layer to a higher layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} requested for transmission which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer and delivered by this layer to a higher layer.

parameter.name: UnknownPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.Interface.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.

parameter.name: IEEEAddress
parameter.description: The IEEE address assigned to this device. A value of "FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF" indicates that this address is unknown.

parameter.name: NetworkAddress
parameter.description: The ZigBee network address assigned to this device.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.description: Whether or not this device is currently present in the ZigBee network as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.4.4.1}}. The ability to list inactive devices is OPTIONAL. If the CPE includes inactive devices in this table, {{param}} MUST be set to {{false}} for each inactive device. The length of time an inactive device remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

parameter.name: ZDOReference
parameter.description: The ZigBee Device Object assigned to this interface.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: IEEEAddress
parameter.description: The IEEE address assigned to this device. A value of "FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF" indicates that this address is unknown.

parameter.name: NetworkAddress
parameter.description: The ZigBee network address assigned to this device.

parameter.name: BindingTableNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: GroupNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ApplicationEndpointNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.NodeDescriptor.
object.description: The {{object}} object describes the node capabilities of the ZigBee device as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.3.2.3 Node Descriptor}}.

parameter.name: LogicalType
parameter.description: The type of ZigBee device that is extracted from the Logical Type Field as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|Table 2.29}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: ComplexDescriptorSupported
parameter.description: When {{true}}, specifies that the {{object|#.ComplexDescriptor}} object is supported for this ZigBee device.

parameter.name: UserDescriptorSupported
parameter.description: When {{true}}, specifies that the {{object|#.UserDescriptor}} object is supported for this ZigBee device.

parameter.name: FrequencyBand
parameter.description: Specifies the frequency bands that are supported by the underlying IEEE 802.15.4 radio utilized by the ZigBee device. {{list}} {{enum}}

parameter.name: MACCapability
parameter.description: Specifies the IEEE 802.15.4-2003 MAC sub-layer capabilities for this ZigBee device. {{list}} {{enum}}

enumeration.description: The current power source is mains power
The receiver is on when idle

parameter.name: ManufactureCode
parameter.description: Specifies a manufacturer code that is allocated by the ZigBee Alliance, relating the manufacturer to the device.

parameter.name: MaximumBufferSize
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum buffer size, in {{units}}, of the network sub-layer data unit (NSDU) for this ZigBee device.

parameter.name: MaximumIncomingTransferSize
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum size, in {{units}}, of the application sub-layer data unit (ASDU) that can be transferred to this ZigBee device in one single message transfer.

parameter.name: MaximumOutgoingTransferSize
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum size, in {{units}}, of the application sub-layer data unit (ASDU) that can be transferred from this ZigBee device in one single message transfer.

parameter.name: ServerMask
parameter.description: Specifies the system server capabilities of this ZigBee device. {{list}} {{enum}}

parameter.name: DescriptorCapability
parameter.description: Specifies the descriptor capabilities of this ZigBee device. {{list}} {{enum}}

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.PowerDescriptor.
object.description: The {{object}} object describes the power capabilities of the ZigBee device as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.3.2.4 Node Power Descriptor}}.

parameter.name: CurrentPowerMode
parameter.description: Specifies the current sleep/power-saving mode of the ZigBee device. {{enum}}

parameter.name: AvailablePowerSource
parameter.description: Specifies the power sources available on this ZigBee device. {{list}} {{enum}}

parameter.name: CurrentPowerSource
parameter.description: The current power source field specifies the current power source being utilized by the node. {{enum}}

parameter.name: CurrentPowerSourceLevel
parameter.description: Specifies the level of charge of the current power source. {{enum}}

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.UserDescriptor.
object.description: The {{object}} object is an optional descriptor that describes user defined capabilities of the ZigBee device as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.3.2.7 User Descriptor}}. The {{object}} object contains information that allows the user to identify the device using a user-friendly character string, such as "Bedroom TV" or "Stairs Light".

parameter.name: DescriptorAvailable
parameter.description: When {{true}}, the User Descriptor recorded has been received from the target device.

parameter.name: Description
parameter.description: Specifies the information that allows the user to identify the ZigBee device using a user-friendly character string, such as "Bedroom TV" or "Stairs light".

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.ComplexDescriptor.
object.description: The {{object}} object is an optional descriptor that describes extended capabilities of the ZigBee device as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.3.2.6 Complex Descriptor}}.

parameter.name: DescriptorAvailable
parameter.description: When {{true}}, the Complex Descriptor recorded has been received from the target device.

parameter.name: Language
parameter.description: Specifies the ISO 639-1 language code as defined in {{bibref|ISO639-1}}.

parameter.name: CharacterSet
parameter.description: Specifies the ISO 646 character set as defined in {{bibref|ISO646-1991}}.

parameter.name: ManufacturerName
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the manufacturer of the ZigBee device.

parameter.name: ModelName
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the manufacturer's model of the ZigBee device.

parameter.name: SerialNumber
parameter.description: Specifies the manufacturer's serial number of the ZigBee device.

parameter.name: DeviceURL
parameter.description: Specifies the URL through which more information relating to the ZigBee device can be obtained.

parameter.name: Icon
parameter.description: The icon field contains an octet string which carries the data for an icon that can represent the ZigBee device. The format of the icon MUST be a 32-by-32-pixel PNG image.

parameter.name: IconURL
parameter.description: Specifies the URL through which the icon for the ZigBee device can be obtained.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.Security.
object.description: The {{object}} object provides the configuration capabilities needed to perform the Security Management functionality defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 4 Security Management}}.

parameter.name: TrustCenterAddress
parameter.description: Specifies the IEEE address of a special device trusted by devices within a ZigBee network to distribute keys for the purpose of network and end-to-end application configuration management.

parameter.name: SecurityLevel
parameter.description: Specifies how an outgoing frame is to be secured, how an incoming frame purportedly has been secured; it also indicates whether or not the payload is encrypted and to what extent data authenticity over the frame is provided, as reflected by the length of the message integrity code (MIC). {{enum}}

parameter.name: TimeOutPeriod
parameter.description: The period of time, in {{units}}, that this ZigBee device will wait for an expected security protocol frame.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.Network.
object.description: The {{object}} object provides the configuration capabilities needed to by a ZigBee Device to operate within a ZigBee Area Network as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.5.2.4 Network Manager}}.

parameter.name: NeighborNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.Network.Neighbor.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} object provides the configuration capabilities needed to by a ZigBee Device to operate within a ZigBee Area Network as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.5.2.4 Network Manager}}.

parameter.name: Neighbor
parameter.description: Neighbor of this ZigBee device. The value MUST be the path name of a row in the ZigBee.ZDO table. If the referenced row is deleted then this entry MUST be deleted.

parameter.name: LQI
parameter.description: The LQI field specified link quality identification (LQI) for neighbor ZigBee device.

parameter.name: Relationship
parameter.description: The relationship between the neighbor and this device.{{enum}}

parameter.name: PermitJoin
parameter.description: An indication of whether the neighbor device is accepting join requests.{{enum}}

parameter.name: Depth
parameter.description: The tree depth of the neighbor device. A value of 0x00 indicates that the device is the ZigBee coordinator for the network.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.NodeManager.
object.description: The {{object}} object describes the configuration capabilities related for remote management of the ZigBee Area Network as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.5.2.6 Node Manager}}.

parameter.name: RoutingTableNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.NodeManager.RoutingTable.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} object describes the route table as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|table 3.51 Routing Table Entry}}.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: The ZigBee network address of this route.

parameter.name: NextHopAddress
parameter.description: Specifies the network address of the next hop ZigBee device on the way to the destination ZigBee device.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of the route entry. {{enum}}

parameter.name: MemoryConstrained
parameter.description: A flag indicating whether the device is a memory constrained concentrator.

parameter.name: ManyToOne
parameter.description: A flag indicating that the destination is a concentrator that issued a many to-one request.

parameter.name: RouteRecordRequired
parameter.description: A flag indicating that a route record command frame should be sent to the destination prior to the next data packet.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.Binding.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} object describes the configuration capabilities related to maintaining a ZigBee Device's Binding Table as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.2.8.2 Binding}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the use of this binding on the device.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: SourceEndpoint
parameter.description: Specifies the source endpoint used in this binding entry.

parameter.name: SourceAddress
parameter.description: Specifies the source address used in this binding entry.

parameter.name: ClusterId
parameter.description: Specifies the cluster identifier used in this binding entry.

parameter.name: DestinationAddressMode
parameter.description: Specifies the type of destination address used for this binding entry. {{enum}}

parameter.name: DestinationEndpoint
parameter.description: Specifies the destination endpoint for the binding entry. The value of this field is valid when the value of the {{param|DestinationAddressMode}} is {{enum|Endpoint|DestinationAddressMode}}.

parameter.name: IEEEDestinationAddress
parameter.description: Specifies the IEEE destination address for this binding entry. The value of this field is valid when the value of the {{param|DestinationAddressMode}} is {{enum|Endpoint|DestinationAddressMode}}.

parameter.name: GroupDestinationAddress
parameter.description: Specifies the group destination address for this binding entry. The value of this field is valid when the value of the {{param|DestinationAddressMode}} is {{enum|Group|DestinationAddressMode}}.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.Group.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} object describes the configuration capabilities related to maintaining a ZigBee Device's Group Table as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.5.2.7 Group Manager}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the use of this group on the device.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: GroupId
parameter.description: The Group Identifier for this object as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|table 2.25 Group Table Entry Format}}.

parameter.name: EndpointList
parameter.description: The list of application endpoints assigned as a member of this {{object}} object.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.ApplicationEndpoint.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} object describes the application endpoint as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.1.2 Application Framework}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the use of this application endpoint on the device.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: EndpointId
parameter.description: The Endpoint Identifier for this object as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.1.2 Application Framework}}. An {{object}} with an {{param}} value of 0 is designated as the device application: This is a special application that is responsible for device operation and contains logic to manage the device's networking and general maintenance features.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.ZDO.{i}.ApplicationEndpoint.{i}.SimpleDescriptor.
object.description: The {{object}} object contains the attributes of the Simple Descriptor of an application endpoint, as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.3.2.5 Simple Descriptor}}.

parameter.name: ProfileId
parameter.description: Specifies the application profile that is supported on this endpoint. Application profiles are agreements for messages, message formats, andprocessing actions that enable developers to create an interoperable, distributed application employing application entities that reside on separate ZigBee devices. These application profiles enable applications to send commands, request data, and process commands and requests as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.1.2.1 Application Profiles}}.

parameter.name: DeviceId
parameter.description: Application device identifier, as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.3.2.5.3 Application Device Identifier Field}}.

parameter.name: DeviceVersion
parameter.description: Application device version, as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007|section 2.3.2.5.4 Application Device Version Field}}.

parameter.name: InputClusterList
parameter.description: {{list}} Specifies the input cluster identifiers to be matched by the ZigBee coordinator by remote Zigbee device's output cluster list for this {{object}} object.

parameter.name: OutputClusterList
parameter.description: {{list}} Specifies the output cluster identifiers to be matched by the ZigBee coordinator by remote Zigbee device's input cluster list for this {{object}} object.

object.name: Device.ZigBee.Discovery.
object.description: This object is used for managing the discovery of ZigBee devices within a ZigBee Area Network. ZigBee Devices are discovered via the {{object|#.ZDO}} instance associated with the ZigBee Coordinator of an Area Network.

parameter.name: AreaNetworkNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.ZigBee.Discovery.AreaNetwork.{i}.
object.description: This object specifies the ZigBee devices that are discovered by the {{param|Coordinator}}. As the ZigBee specification does not provide a discovery protocol between the CWMP proxy and the ZigBee coordinator, the {{object}} object is provisioned and not discovered.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables discovery of the ZigBee devices in this {{object}}.

parameter.name: LastUpdate
parameter.description: The date and time when this {{object}} or its member devices (i.e., the devices with ZDOs listed in {{param|ZDOList}}) were updated due to a discovery operation.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of the current discovery operation. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: The discovery operation has not been executed and there are no valid discovery results available)

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Coordinator
parameter.description: The Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) or IP address of the ZigBee Coordinator. The coordinator MAY be located within the CPE. In this scenario the ACS or CPE MAY use the value of "localhost".

parameter.name: ZDOReference
parameter.description: The ZDO object for this device that is used to discover the ZigBee capabilities of attached devices. {{reference}}

parameter.name: ZDOList
parameter.description: The list of ZDO objects discovered in this Area Network by the ZigBee Coordinator. {{reference}}

object.name: Device.Bridging.
object.description: Layer 2 bridging configuration. Specifies bridges between different layer 2 interfaces.
