object.description: Each {{object}} instance represents a MQTT bridge server to be used for a {{object|##.Bridge}}. A remote MQTT broker, which is connected by a MQTT bridge can be reachable via several host addresses each represented by its own {{object}} table entry. For an active MQTT bridge at least one enabled entry has to exist. If a MQTT bridge gets enabled by setting the parameter {{param|##.Bridge.{i}.Enable}} to {{true}}, which either has an empty {{object}} table or the {{object}} table only contains instances whose {{param|Enable}} is set to {{false}}, the {{param|##.Bridge.{i}.Status}} has to be set to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|##.Bridge.{i}.Status}}. Any attempt to delete an instance, which is currently in use ({{param|##.Bridge.{i}.ServerConnection}} refers to the instance to be deleted), has to be rejected.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.description: The priority of this {{object}} that is used by the {{object|##.Bridge}} when determining the {{object}} to connect to. The {{object|##.Bridge}} MUST contact the {{object}} with the lowest-numbered priority that the {{object|##.Bridge}} can reach as defined in {{bibref|RFC2782}}. The selection of {{object}}s with the same {{param}} value utilizes the {{param|Weight}} parameter to determine which {{object}} is selected by the {{object|##.Bridge}}. This value is only used if {{param|##.Bridge.{i}.ServerSelectionAlgorithm}} is set to {{enum|Priority|##.Bridge.{i}.ServerSelectionAlgorithm}}.

parameter.name: Weight
parameter.description: This parameter specifies a relative weight for entries with the same {{param|Priority}}. The mechanism is defined in {{bibref|RFC2782}}. A value of -1 indicates that the implementation of this parameter is specific to the Vendor. This value is only used if {{param|##.Bridge.{i}.ServerSelectionAlgorithm}} is set to {{enum|Priority|##.Bridge.{i}.ServerSelectionAlgorithm}}.

parameter.name: Address
parameter.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) or IP address of the MQTT broker server this {{object|##.Bridge}} connects to. If the value of this parameter is a FQDN that resolves to multiple addresses then each address SHOULD be attempted (in an implementation-specific order) until a connection can be made or all addresses are exhausted, in which case the next {{object}} instance (based on rules defined over the selected {{param|##.Bridge.{i}.ServerSelectionAlgorithm}}) SHOULD be used.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: Port number of the MQTT broker server this {{object|##.Bridge}} connects to.

object.name: Device.MQTT.Broker.{i}.Bridge.{i}.Subscription.{i}.
object.description: List of MQTT subscriptions handled over the bridge.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Setting Enable to {{true}} activates the handling of this subscription instance. In case of incoming directions ({{param|Direction}} is either {{enum|in|Direction}} or {{enum|both|Direction}}) the topic is subscribed over the bridge at the remote MQTT broker with a MQTT SUBSCRIBE message if {{param}} is set to {{true}} or unsubscribed from the remote MQTT broker with a MQTT UNSUBSCRIBE message if the value is set to {{false}}. The actual status of the subscription is indicated with {{param|Status}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this subscription. {{enum}} The {{enum|Enabled}} value indicates that the this subscription is active. In case of incoming directions ({{param|Direction}} is either {{enum|in|Direction}} or {{enum|both|Direction}}) the topic was successfully subscribed with the remote MQTT broker. The {{enum|Disabled}} value indicates that this subscription is not used. The {{enum|Error}} value indicates that an error occured (e.g. an subscription could not be made with the remote MQTT broker) and the subscription is not in use.

parameter.name: Topic
parameter.description: Name of the subscribed topic. Topic names may contain wildcards according to the rules specified in {{bibref|MQTT31|Appendix A}} and {{bibref|MQTT311|4.7}}.

parameter.name: Direction
parameter.description: The direction of the subscription. {{enum}}.

enumeration.description: Indicates that all matching topics will be sent over the bridge to the next MQTT broker.
Indicates that all matching topics will be received over the bridge from the next MQTT broker.
Indicates that all matching topics will be sent and received over the bridge.

parameter.name: QoS
parameter.description: The MQTT QoS level assigned with the subscription (see {{bibref|MQTT31|4.1}} and {{bibref|MQTT311|4.3}}).

parameter.name: LocalPrefix
parameter.description: The local prefix is used for remapping received topics to the local topics of the MQTT broker and to select the topics to be sent over bridge to the remote MQTT broker. * In incoming direction ({{param|Direction}} is either {{enum|in|Direction}} or {{enum|both|Direction}}): : For remote topics received over the bridge the MQTT broker adds the LocalPrefix in front of the received topic, before processing it. :: '' '' : ''Example:'' :: Topic is "/bus/+", LocalPrefix is "/local", Direction is "in" :: MQTT broker receives message with topic "/bus/tr181" over bridge => MQTT broker uses topic "/local/bus/tr181" for internal processing * In outgoing direction ({{param|Direction}} is either {{enum|out|Direction}} or {{enum|both|Direction}}): : For selection of the topics to be sent over the bridge the MQTT broker uses the combination of {{param}} and {{param|Topic}} to match the topics to be sent over bridge, and removes the {{param}} from the selected topic before sending it over the bridge. :: '' '' : ''Example:'' :: Topic is "/bus/+", LocalPrefix is "/local", Direction is "out" :: MQTT broker receives message with topic "/local/bus/tr181" from a MQTT client => MQTT broker sends topic "/bus/tr181" to remote MQTT broker

parameter.name: RemotePrefix
parameter.description: The remote prefix is used for remapping topics to the remote MQTT broker topic lists. * In incoming direction ({{param|Direction}} is either {{enum|in|Direction}} or {{enum|both|Direction}}): : For remote topics received over the bridge the MQTT broker removes the remote prefix topic from the received topic (before handling the {{param|LocalPrefix}}), before processing it. :: '' '' : ''Example:'' :: Topic is "/bus/+", LocalPrefix is "/local", RemotePrefix is "/remote", Direction is "in" :: MQTT broker receives message with topic "/remote/bus/tr181" over bridge => MQTT broker uses topic "/local/bus/tr181" for internal processing : During activation of the bridge, the MQTT broker prepends the {{param|Topic}} with {{param}} topic and subscribes to the remote MQTT broker with it, in order to receive all applicable remote topics. :: '' '' : ''Example:'' :: Topic is "/bus/+", RemotePrefix is "/remote", Direction is "in" :: MQTT broker sends a subscription to the remote MQTT broker with the topic "/remote/bus/+". * In outgoing direction ({{param|Direction}} is either {{enum|out|Direction}} or {{enum|both|Direction}}): : For all topics to be sent over the bridge ({{param|Direction}} is either {{enum|out|Direction}} or {{enum|both|Direction}}), the RemotePrefix will be prepended to the topic after the {{param|LocalPrefix}} has been processed and before sending the message over the bridge. :: '' '' : ''Example:'' :: Topic is "/bus/+", LocalPrefix is "/local", RemotePrefix is "/remote" Direction is "out" :: MQTT broker receives message with topic "/local/bus/tr181" from a MQTT client => MQTT broker sends topic "/remote/bus/tr181" to remote MQTT broker

object.name: Device.MQTT.Broker.{i}.Stats.
object.description: The MQTT broker statistics values. These will reset with each MQTT broker start, either after reboot or if the MQTT broker gets (re-)enabled.

parameter.name: TotalNumberOfClients
parameter.description: Total number of MQTT clients registered with the MQTT broker.

parameter.name: NumberOfActiveClients
parameter.description: Number of MQTT clients, which have a connection with the MQTT broker established.

parameter.name: NumberOfInactiveClients
parameter.description: Number of MQTT clients, which have no connection with the MQTT broker established.

parameter.name: Subscriptions
parameter.description: Number of subscriptions held by the MQTT broker.

parameter.name: PublishSent
parameter.description: Number of publish messages sent by the MQTT broker.

parameter.name: PublishReceived
parameter.description: Number of publish messages received by the MQTT broker.

parameter.name: MQTTMessagesSent
parameter.description: Total number of MQTT messages sent by the MQTT broker.

parameter.name: MQTTMessagesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of MQTT messages received by the MQTT broker.

parameter.name: ConnectionErrors
parameter.description: Number of connection errors.

parameter.name: PublishErrors
parameter.description: Number of errors which prevented sending publish messages

object.name: Device.DynamicDNS.
object.description: Properties for Dynamic DNS.

parameter.name: ClientNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ServerNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: SupportedServices
parameter.description: List of Dynamic DNS service names that are supported by the CPE.

object.name: Device.DynamicDNS.Client.{i}.
object.description: Client properties for Dynamic DNS. A dynamic DNS client is responsible for verifying IP address changes and updating information from a subscribed account on a Dynamic DNS Server. For enabled table entries, if {{param|Server}} is not a valid reference then the table entry is inoperable and the CPE MUST set the {{param|Status}} to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|Status}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this Dynamic DNS Client.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Status of this Dynamic DNS Client.

enumeration.description: The Dynamic DNS Client is trying to connect to the Server.
The Dynamic DNS Client is in the authentication phase.
The Dynamic DNS Client has performed an update request since the last IP address change.
An error has occurred during the communication with the Server. The {{param|LastError}} parameter is updated with the detail of this error.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: LastError
parameter.description: The last error this Dynamic DNS Client has encountered. The parameter MAY instead indicate a vendor-specific cause, which MUST use the format defined in {{bibref|TR-106}}.

parameter.name: Server
parameter.description: The DynamicDNS server associated with this Dynamic DNS Client. {{reference}}

parameter.name: Interface
Username
parameter.description: Username used by this Dynamic DNS Client to authenticate with the Server.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password used by this Dynamic DNS Client to authenticate with the Server.

parameter.name: HostnameNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.DynamicDNS.Client.{i}.Hostname.{i}.
object.description: Each table entry represents a fully qualified domain name updated by this Dynamic DNS Client.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this Hostname.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Status of this Hostname.

enumeration.description: The Hostname has been updated with the current IP address.
The IP address has changed since last update.
The Client is trying to update this Hostname.
The Hostname doesn't exist for this Dynamic DNS account.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Fully qualified domain name that has to be updated with the IP address. If the name is set to another value, the Client MUST immediately send an update request to the Server.

parameter.name: LastUpdate
parameter.description: The date time of the last successful update of this name to the Dynamic DNS Server.

object.name: Device.DynamicDNS.Server.{i}.
object.description: Table of Dynamic DNS servers available for this CPE.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables Dynamic DNS Server.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the Dynamic DNS Server.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: ServiceName
parameter.description: Dynamic DNS service used to contact this server. {{reference}}

parameter.name: ServerAddress
parameter.description: Host name or IP address of the Dynamic DNS server.

parameter.name: ServerPort
parameter.description: Port number of the Dynamic DNS server.

parameter.name: SupportedProtocols
parameter.description: Indicates the protocols that are supported by the CPE for sending requests to the Dynamic DNS server. {{list}} This list depends on the Dynamic DNS service defined by the {{param|ServiceName}} parameter.

parameter.name: Protocol
parameter.description: Indicates the protocol used to send requests to the Dynamic DNS server.

parameter.name: CheckInterval
parameter.description: Interval (in {{units}}) between two checks for IP change. A value of zero indicates that the CPE knows when IP changes and doesnt need to check it periodically.

parameter.name: RetryInterval
parameter.description: Initial retry interval (in {{units}}) after a failed request. This parameter can be used as a fixed value or as part of a retry interval calculation.

parameter.name: MaxRetries
parameter.description: Maximum number of retries after a failed request. When the maximum number is reached, no further requests are sent until the context changes. A value of 0 means that there are no retries after a failed request.

object.name: Device.LEDs.
object.description: This object describes the LEDs on the device.

parameter.name: LEDNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LEDs.LED.{i}.
object.description: Each instance of this object describes an LED on the device. The default illumination characteristics (e.g., Color, Brightness) of an in use LED is vendor specific. When a cycle completes (i.e., {{param|CyclePeriodRepetitions}} = 0), the LED reverts back to its default illumination characteristics. When the value of the {{param|Status}} parameter is {{enum|Controlled|Status}}, then the value of {{param|CycleElementNumberOfEntries}} and {{param|CycleElementNumberOfEntries}} parameters SHOULD be 0. When the value of the {{param|RelativeXPosition}} and {{param|RelativeYPosition}} parameters are 0, this indicates that the position of the LED is unknown.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The internal name used to identify this LED.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of the LED.

enumeration.description: The LED is currently not in use.
The LED is currently being used by the CPE.
Indicates that the LED is controlled from an electronic circuit which cannot be monitored.
The LED status cannot be determined by the CPE.

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.description: The textual purpose that represents the visual display of the LED (e.g., Broadband Down).

parameter.name: CyclePeriodRepetitions
parameter.description: The number of cycle periods left for this LED. As each cycle period is completed this parameter is reduced by 1. A value of -1 indicates an infinite number of cycle period repetitions.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.description: The location of the LED as the user looks at the front of the device in its typical orientation (e.g., on-end, flat).

parameter.name: RelativeXPosition
parameter.description: The relative x position of the LED from left to right (x) and top to bottom (y) as the user looks at the device from the orientation identified in the {{param|Location}} parameter in its typical orientation (e.g., on-end, flat).

parameter.name: RelativeYPosition
parameter.description: The relative y position of the LED from left to right (x) and top to bottom (y) as the user looks at the device from the orientation identified in the {{param|Location}} parameter in its typical orientation (e.g., on-end, flat).

parameter.name: CycleElementNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LEDs.LED.{i}.CycleElement.{i}.
object.description: Each instance of this object describes the LED characteristics for a portion of the LED cycle period. The pattern of lighting for the LED corresponding to this table (i.e., the LED cycle period) is defined by the illumination of the LED according to the entries in this table, taken sequentially in the order specified by the {{param|Order}} parameter, with the duration for the portion of the LED illumination corresponding to a given instance specified by the {{param|Duration}} parameter. The other parameters of the instance of this object (e.g., Color, Brightness) describes the illumination characteristics applied to the LED for this {{object}} instance. The length of the complete LED cycle is the sum of the Duration parameters for all of the entries in this table.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance.

parameter.name: Order
parameter.description: The relative order of this {{object}} in the LED's cycle period.

parameter.name: Color
parameter.description: The color being displayed by the LED RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088). Note: If the parameter is set to an unsupported color the CPE MUST NOT infer a different color.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: The duration, in {{units}}, for this element of the cycle period.

parameter.name: FadeInterval
parameter.description: The interval corresponding to this {{object}} instance, in {{units}}, from the starting from the target illumination characteristics of the previous {{object}} instance to the target illumination characteristics of this {{object}} instance. The transition to the target illumination characteristics is uniformly interpolated "perceptually" over the value of this {{param}} parameter.

object.name: Device.LEDs.LED.{i}.CurrentCycleElement.
object.description: This object describes the status of the current cycle element for this LED.

parameter.name: CycleElementReference
parameter.description: This object describes the current properties of the {{object|#.CycleElement.{i}}} object instance that is currently active. {{reference}} If the LED instances does not have a current cycle element active, this parameter MUST be set to {{empty}}.

parameter.name: Color
parameter.description: The color, formatted as RGB hexadecimal notation (e.g., FF0088), that is currently being displayed by the LED.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: The remaining duration, in {{units}}, for this element of the cycle period.

object.name: Device.BASAPM.
object.description: This object represents the objects necessary to manage and control the functionality for tests that utilize the Broadband Access Service Attributes and Performance Metrics measurement test framework as defined in by {{bibref|TR-304}}.

parameter.name: MeasurementEndpointNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.BASAPM.MeasurementEndpoint.{i}.
object.description: This object represents the measurement endpoint that provides additional contextual information regarding the measurement agent.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: MeasurementAgent
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|##.LMAP.MeasurementAgent}} object that is associated with this measurement endpoint.}}

parameter.name: DeviceOwnership
parameter.description: This parameter describes the ownership of the device that hosts the measurement endpoint. {{enum}}

parameter.name: OperationalDomain
parameter.description: This parameter describes the operational domain for this measurement endpoint

parameter.name: InternetDomain
parameter.description: The top level Internet domain used to identify this measurement endpoint.

parameter.name: UseMeasurementEndpointInReports
parameter.description: If the value of this parameter is {{false}} then the Measurement Endpoint MUST not be included in measurement reports.

object.name: Device.BASAPM.MeasurementEndpoint.{i}.ISPDevice.
object.description: This object represents the information necessary to utilize an ISP owned device within the measurement endpoint.

parameter.name: ReferencePoint
parameter.description: This parameter describes the measurement reference point of the measurement endpoint. {{enum}}

parameter.name: GeographicalLocation
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|###.DeviceInfo.Location}} object that describes the geographic location of the measurement endpoint}}

object.name: Device.BASAPM.MeasurementEndpoint.{i}.CustomerDevice.
object.description: This object represents the information necessary to utilize customer owned device within the measurement endpoint.

parameter.name: EquipmentIdentifier
parameter.description: This parameter describes the customer equipment identifier of the measurement endpoint.

parameter.name: CustomerIdentifier
parameter.description: The unique customer identifier within the operational domain for this measurement endpoint.

object.name: Device.LMAP.
object.description: This object represents the objects necessary to manage and control the functionality for Large-Scale Measurement of Broadband Performance{{bibref|RFC7594}} as defined in by {{bibref|LMAPIFM}}.

parameter.name: MeasurementAgentNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ReportNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: EventNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.
object.description: This object represents the measurement agent that performs measurement tasks and reporting functions defined in {{bibref|RFC7594}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: Version of the measurement agent.

parameter.name: LastStarted
parameter.description: Date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, in UTC that the measurement agent was successfully started.

parameter.name: CapabilityTags
parameter.description: Capabilities of the measurement agent that cannot be expressed elsewhere in the data model.

parameter.name: Identifier
parameter.description: Identifier of the {{object}} instance.

parameter.name: GroupIdentifier
parameter.description: Identifier of the measurement group of interest to which the measurement agent belongs.

parameter.name: MeasurementPoint
parameter.description: Identifier of the measurement point indicating where the measurement agent is located on a path as defined in [bibref|RFC7398}}.

parameter.name: UseAgentIdentifierInReports
parameter.description: If the value of the {{param|Identifier}} parameter is not {{empty}} and the value of this parameter is {{false}} then the value of the {{param|Identifier}} parameter MUST not be included in measurement reports.

parameter.name: UseGroupIdentifierInReports
parameter.description: If the value of the {{param|GroupIdentifier}} parameter is not {{empty}} and the value of this parameter is {{false}} then the value of the {{param|GroupIdentifier}} parameter MUST not be included in measurement reports.

parameter.name: UseMeasurementPointInReports
parameter.description: If the value of the {{param|MeasurementPoint}} parameter is not {{empty}} and the value of this parameter is {{false}} then the value of the {{param|MeasurementPoint}} parameter MUST not be included in measurement reports.

parameter.name: PublicCredential
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|##.Security.Certificate}} object that is used to identify this measurement agent}}

parameter.name: PrivateCredential
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|##.Security.Certificate}} object that is used to contain the private keys for this measurement agent}}

parameter.name: EventLog
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|##.DeviceInfo.VendorLogFile}} object that is used to record events for this measurement agent}}

parameter.name: TaskCapabilityNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ScheduleNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: TaskNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: CommunicationChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: InstructionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.TaskCapability.{i}.
object.description: This object represents a capabilities, in the context of a task, that are supported by the measurement agent. Types of capabilities include: Report tasks, Configuration Tasks and Instruction Tasks.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of the supported task.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: Version of the task.

parameter.name: TaskCapabilityRegistryNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.TaskCapability.{i}.Registry.{i}.
object.description: This object represents a registry function and an associated list of roles supported by this measurement agent

parameter.name: RegistryEntry
parameter.description: A URI ({{bibref|RFC3986}}) that is the value of the task registry entry as defined in {{bibref|LMAPREG}} or a value for a task that is understood by the measurement agent, measurement controller and measurement collector.

parameter.name: Roles
parameter.description: {{list| representing the roles of the function}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Controller.
object.description: This objects represents the measurement controller that is assigned to a measurement agent.

parameter.name: ControllerTimeout
parameter.description: The timer, in {{units}}, that is started after each successful contact with a measurement controller. When the timer reaches the timeout en event is raised indicating that connectivity to the controller has been lost.

parameter.name: ControlSchedules
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|a {{object|#.Schedule}} object}} This parameter lists the available control schedules for invoking control tasks by the measurement agent.

parameter.name: ControlTasks
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|a {{object|#.Task}} object}} This parameter lists the available control tasks that can be invoked by the measurement agent.

parameter.name: ControlChannels
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|a {{object|#.CommunicationChannel}} object}} The measurement agent to measurement controller channel is used for conveying results of communication sessions with the configuration, instruction status and logging information elements defined in defined in {{bibref|LMAPIFM}}.

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Schedule.{i}.
object.description: This object represents a schedule that is associated with a set of scheduled actions to be performed by a measurement agent. Note: Actions of an occurrence of this {{object}} are gracefully terminated by the defining either the {{param|End}} or {{param|Duration}} parameters. Only one of these parameters may be defined at a time.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of the schedule.

parameter.name: State
parameter.description: The current operational state of the Schedule. Only one instance of the schedule is active. An active schedule is defined where the {{param}} parameter has a value of {{enum|Running|State}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: Start
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|##.Event}} object that is used define the event to start an occurrence of this {{object}}}}

parameter.name: End
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|##.Event}} object that is used define the event to gracefully terminate all actions associated with an occurrence of this {{object}}}}.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.description: When the {{param}} value is not 0, this parameter is used define the duration, in {{units}}, where after this duration all actions associated with an occurrence of this {{object}} are gracefully terminated.

parameter.name: Tags
parameter.description: {{list|each entry represents tags that are to be reported together with the measurement results.}}

parameter.name: SuppressionTags
parameter.description: {{list|representing the suppression tags to be matched}}

parameter.name: ExecutionMode
parameter.description: This parameter describes the execution method to apply to this schedule for the associated Actions. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Actions are executed in sequence as defined by the value of the {{param|Action.{i}.Order}} parameter. The first Scheduled Action of the DestinationOutput is provided the input.
Actions are executed in parallel. The all Scheduled Actions of the DestinationOutput are provided the input.
Actions are executed in sequence where the output of one Action is used as the input of subsequent Action. The first Scheduled Action of the DestinationOutput is provided the input.

parameter.name: LastInvocation
parameter.description: Date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, in UTC that the {{object}} was invoked by the measurement agent.

parameter.name: Storage
parameter.description: The amount of secondary storage, in {{units}}, allocated to an instance of this {{object}}. The value of this parameter reflects the amount of allocated physical storage and not the storage used by logical data records. For example the secondary storage can be the storage allocated in a file system holding temporary data.

parameter.name: ActionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Schedule.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object represents the statistics associated with this object.

parameter.name: Invocations
parameter.description: Number of invocations of this schedule. This counter does not include suppressed invocations or invocations that were prevented due to an overlap with a previous invocation of this schedule.

parameter.name: Suppressions
parameter.description: Number of suppressed executions of this schedule.

parameter.name: Overlaps
parameter.description: Number of executions prevented due to overlaps with a previous invocation of this schedule.

parameter.name: Failures
parameter.description: Number of failed executions of this schedule. A failed execution is an execution where at least one action failed.

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Schedule.{i}.Action.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an action that is associated with the this {{object|##.Schedule}} object.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object|##.Schedule.{i}.Action}} object. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: State
parameter.description: The current operational state of the {{object}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: Order
parameter.description: The order of the scheduled action.

parameter.name: Task
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|##.Task}} object used in this scheduled action}}

parameter.name: OutputDestination
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|a {{object|##.Schedule}} object used to receive the output(s) of this scheduled action}}

parameter.name: SuppressionTags
parameter.description: {{list|representing the suppression tags to be matched}}

parameter.name: Tags
parameter.description: {{list|each entry represents tags that are to be reported together with the measurement results.}}

parameter.name: Storage
parameter.description: The amount of secondary storage, in {{units}}, allocated to an instance of this {{object}}. The value of this parameter reflects the amount of allocated physical storage and not the storage used by logical data records. For example the secondary storage can be the storage allocated in a file system holding temporary data.

parameter.name: LastInvocation
parameter.description: Date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, in UTC that the {{object}} was invoked by the measurement agent.

parameter.name: LastSuccessfulCompletion
parameter.description: Date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, in UTC of a successful completion of the {{object}}.

parameter.name: LastSuccessfulStatusCode
parameter.description: The status code returned by successful execution of the {{object}}. A value of 0 indicates successful completion.

parameter.name: LastSuccessfulMessage
parameter.description: The message associated with the successful completion of the {{object}}.

parameter.name: LastFailedCompletion
parameter.description: Date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, in UTC of a failure to complete the {{object}}.

parameter.name: LastFailedStatusCode
parameter.description: The status code returned by failed execution of the {{object}}. A value of 0 indicates successful completion.

parameter.name: LastFailedMessage
parameter.description: The message associated with the failure to complete the task.

parameter.name: OptionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Schedule.{i}.Action.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object represents the statistics associated with this object.

parameter.name: Invocations
parameter.description: Number of invocations of this action. This counter does not include suppressed invocations or invocations that were prevented due to an overlap with a previous invocation of this schedule.

parameter.name: Suppressions
parameter.description: Number of suppressed executions of this action.

parameter.name: Overlaps
parameter.description: Number of executions prevented due to overlaps with a previous invocation of this action.

parameter.name: Failures
parameter.description: Number of failed executions of this action. A failed execution is an execution where at least one action failed.

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Schedule.{i}.Action.{i}.Option.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an option associated with the Scheduled Action. When an option with the same Name exists between the Seheduled Action's Option and The Task's option, the option of the Scheduled Action takes precedence over the option associated with the Task.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Order
parameter.description: The order of the Option.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The name of the option. When the value of this parameter is equal to "channel", the option value specifies the Communication Channel used for this scheduled task.

parameter.name: Value
parameter.description: The value associated with the Option.

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Task.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} object defines the configuration for a task that can be performed by {{object|##.MeasurementAgent}} objects. Tasks are performed by {{object|##.MeasurementAgent}} objects when a {{object|#.Schedule}} object invokes the Task.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of the task.

parameter.name: Tags
parameter.description: {{list|each entry represents tags that are to be reported together with the measurement results.}}

parameter.name: OptionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: RegistryNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Task.{i}.Registry.{i}.
object.description: This object represents a registry function and an associated list of roles for this task

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: RegistryEntry
parameter.description: A URI ({{bibref|RFC3986}}) that is the value of the task registry entry as defined in {{bibref|LMAPREG}} or a value for a task that is understood by the measurement agent, measurement controller and measurement collector.

parameter.name: Roles
parameter.description: {{list| representing the roles of the function}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Task.{i}.Option.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an option associated with the task.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Order
parameter.description: The order of the Option.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The name of the option. When the value of this parameter is equal to "channel", the option value specifies the Communication Channel used for this task.

parameter.name: Value
parameter.description: The value associated with the Option.

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.CommunicationChannel.{i}.
object.description: This object represents the properties communication channel used to establish communication between a measurement agent and other elements of the LMAP framework (e.g., measurement controller, measurement collector). The value of the {{param|Name}} parameter used for conveying information is defined as an option in the Task's or scheduled Task's option parameter. When this object uses the BulkData capability, a {{object|###.BulkData.Profile.{i}}} object instance referred to by this object.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of the channel.

parameter.name: UseBulkDataProfile
parameter.description: Enables or disables the ability to use a bulk data profile for this communication channel

parameter.name: BulkDataProfile
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|###.BulkData.Profile}} object that is used to represent communication channel}}

parameter.name: Target
parameter.description: The URL of the LMAP component that is the target of this communication channel.

parameter.name: TargetPublicCredential
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|###.Security.Certificate}} object that is used to identify the target of this channel}}

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: {{reference|an interface object used to restrict the data transmitted or received using this channel to a specific interface}} If the value of this parameter is {{empty}} the data that is transmitted or received using this channel is able to use any available interface.

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Instruction.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} object defines the instruction to the measurement agent by the measurement controller. At most one {{object}} object for the {{object|##.MeasurementAgent}} instance is enabled at a time. .

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: Date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, in UTC that the {{object}} object or its sub-object's configuration was changed by a measurement agent's controller.

parameter.name: InstructionSchedules
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|a {{object|#.Schedule}} object}} This parameter lists the available instruction schedules for invoking control tasks by the measurement agent.

parameter.name: InstructionTasks
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|a {{object|#.Task}} object}} This parameter lists the available instruction tasks that can be invoked by the measurement agent.

parameter.name: ReportChannels
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|a {{object|#.CommunicationChannel}} object}} This parameter defines the corresponding report channels to be used when reporting results of tasks to a measurement collector.

parameter.name: MeasurementSuppressionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Instruction.{i}.MeasurementSuppression.{i}.
object.description: This object defines the schedules and actions that are suppressed based on criteria defined in the {{param|SuppressionMatch}} parameter.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of the suppression object.

parameter.name: State
parameter.description: The current operational state of the {{object}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: StopRunning
parameter.description: When {{true}}, the measurement agent is instructed to stop running schedules or actions that have been matched by this object.

parameter.name: Start
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|###.Event}} object that is used define the event that to start an occurrence of this {{object}}}} When {{empty}} the default behavior is to perform the suspension event immediately.

parameter.name: End
parameter.description: {{reference|a {{object|###.Event}} object that is used define the event to gracefully suspend all actions associated with an occurrence of this {{object}}}} When {{empty}} the default behavior is for the suspension period to be indefinite.

parameter.name: SuppressionMatch
parameter.description: {{list|representing the match patterns to be used for applying suppression to {{object|##.Schedule.{i}}} (and their actions) and all {{object|##.Schedule.{i}.Action.{i}}} object instances that have a matched using their SuppressionTags parameters}} The match pattern syntax is defined in {{bibref|LMAPIFM}}.

object.name: Device.LMAP.Report.{i}.
object.description: This {{object}} object instance represents a report that is generated by a reporting task where the reporting task is defined as a {{object|#.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Task.{i}}} and executed as a scheduled action ({{object|#.MeasurementAgent.{i}.Schedule.{i}.Action.{i}}}). The {{object}} replicates the {{object|#.MeasurementAgent.{i}}} object instance's data at the time of the action exection. When a {{object|##.BulkData.Profile.{i}}} object instance is used to communicate a {{object}} instance, the CPE adds a {{object|##.BulkData.Profile.{i}.Parameter.{i}}} object instance referring to this {{object}} object instance.

parameter.name: ReportDate
parameter.description: The report date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, that the report was sent to the collector.

parameter.name: AgentIdentifier
parameter.description: Identifier of the measurement agent at the time the measurement was run.

parameter.name: GroupIdentifier
parameter.description: Identifier of the measurement group of interest to which the MA belongs.

parameter.name: MeasurementPoint
parameter.description: Identifier of the measurement point indicating where the measurement agent is located on a path as defined in {{bibref|RFC7398}}.

parameter.name: ResultNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.Report.{i}.Result.{i}.
object.description: The {{object}} object provides the meta-data of the result report of a single executed action that produced the result.

parameter.name: TaskName
parameter.description: Name of the task that produced the result.

parameter.name: ScheduleName
parameter.description: Name of the schedule that produced the result.

parameter.name: ActionName
parameter.description: Name of the action that produced the result.

parameter.name: EventTime
parameter.description: The date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, that the event that triggered the schedule of the action that produced the reported result values in UTC.

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: The date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, that the action started in UTC.

parameter.name: EndTime
parameter.description: The date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, that the action was completed in UTC.

parameter.name: CycleNumber
parameter.description: The cycle number derived from the {{param|EventTime}}. The cycle number is the time, in UTC, closest to the {{param|EventTime}} that is a multiple of the cycle interval of the event that triggered the execution of the schedule. The value is valid if the event that triggered the execution of the schedule has a defined cycle interval. An {{empty}} value represent an invalid CycleNumber. {{pattern}}

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status code returned by the execution of the action.

parameter.name: Tags
parameter.description: {{list|each entry represents tags defined for the schedule, task and action objects that produced this result}}

parameter.name: OptionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ResultConflictNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ResultReportTableNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.Report.{i}.Result.{i}.Option.{i}.
object.description: This object represents an option associated with the task or action object that produced the result.

parameter.name: Order
parameter.description: The order of the Option.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The name of the Option. When the value of this parameter is equal to "channel", the option value specifies the Communication Channel used for this task.

parameter.name: Value
parameter.description: The value associated with the Option.

object.name: Device.LMAP.Report.{i}.Result.{i}.Conflict.{i}.
object.description: This object represents actions that might have impacted the results being reported.

parameter.name: TaskName
parameter.description: Name of the task.

parameter.name: ScheduleName
parameter.description: Name of the schedule.

parameter.name: ActionName
parameter.description: Name of the action.

object.name: Device.LMAP.Report.{i}.Result.{i}.ReportTable.{i}.
object.description: This {{object}} object instances represents a row of results.

parameter.name: ColumnLabels
parameter.description: {{list}} This parameter contains the column labels used for the result. The column labels are ordered with the corresponding entries in the {{object|ResultRow}} table.

parameter.name: ResultReportRowNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: RegistryNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.Report.{i}.Result.{i}.ReportTable.{i}.ResultRow.{i}.
object.description: This {{object}} object instances represents a row of results for the report.

parameter.name: Values
parameter.description: {{list}} This parameter contains an ordered set of values that align to the columns defined in the {{param|#.ColumnLabels}} parameter.

object.name: Device.LMAP.Report.{i}.Result.{i}.ReportTable.{i}.Registry.{i}.
object.description: This object represents a registry function and an associated list of roles for this result report.

parameter.name: RegistryEntry
parameter.description: A URI ({{bibref|RFC3986}}) that is the value of the registry entry as defined in {{bibref|LMAPREG}} or a value for a task that is understood by the measurement agent, measurement controller and measurement collector.

parameter.name: Roles
parameter.description: {{list| representing the roles of the function}}

object.name: Device.LMAP.Event.{i}.
object.description: This object defines the information associated with an event used within the measurement agent. Event instances may be referenced by various objects within the LMAP model.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this {{object}} instance. This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of the Event.

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: This parameter describes the type of {{object}} for this object instance. The timing of the event occurrence is adjusted based on the value of the {{param|RandomnessSpread}} parameter. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Periodic Timing Event. When selected one or more event occurrences are emitted based on the parameters defined in the {{object|PeriodicTimer}} object.
Calendar Timing Event. When selected one or more event occurrences are emitted based on the parameters defined in the {{object|CalendarTimer}} object.
One-off Timing Event. When selected a single event occurrence is emitted based on the parameters defined in the {{object|OneOff}} object.
Immediate Timing Event. When selected a single event occurrence is emitted as soon as possible.
Startup Timing Event. When selected a single event occurrence is emitted when the corresponding measurement agent starts up.
Controller Lost Event. When selected a single event occurrence is emitted when the connectivity to the controller is lost.
Controller Connected Event. When selected a single event occurrence is emitted when the connectivity to the controller is established.

parameter.name: RandomnessSpread
parameter.description: The spread, in {{units}}, of the Uniform Discrete random distribution algorithm. A value of 0 means that the random algorithm is not applied.

parameter.name: CycleInterval
parameter.description: The duration of the time interval, in {{units}}, that used to calculate cycle numbers.

object.name: Device.LMAP.Event.{i}.PeriodicTimer.
object.description: This object defines a periodic timer instance. The periodic timer instance has attributes for when the timer is to begin ({{param|StartTime}}) and end ({{param|EndTime}}) as well as the interval to use.

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: Date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, that the {{object}} instance is to begin operation.

parameter.name: EndTime
parameter.description: Date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, that the {{object}} instance is to end operation.

parameter.name: Interval
parameter.description: The tolerable duration, in {{units}}, of the interval for this {{object}} instance.

object.name: Device.LMAP.Event.{i}.CalendarTimer.
object.description: This object defines a calendar timer instance. The calendar timer instance has attributes for when the timer is to begin ({{param|StartTime}}) and end ({{param|EndTime}}) as well as the schedule of the recurrence. The algrorithm that defines how the schedule elements are evaluated is defined in {{bibref|LMAPIFM}}. If the value of any of the {{param|ScheduleMonths}}, {{param|ScheduleDaysOfMonth}}, {{param|ScheduleDaysOfWeek}}, {{param|ScheduleHoursOfDay}}, {{param|ScheduleMinutesOfHour}} or {{param|ScheduleSecondsOfMinute}} is {{empty}} then any actions that use this object will not be invoked.

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: Date and time that the {{object}} instance is to begin this operation.

parameter.name: EndTime
parameter.description: Date and time that the {{object}} instance is to end this operation.

parameter.name: ScheduleMonths
parameter.description: This parameter represents either a list of the months of year that are applied to the schedule or an asterisk (*) that represents all the elements of the list. Each entry in the months of the year list can be a numeric value or the name of the month (january (1), february (2), march (3), april (4), may (5), june (6), july (7), august (8), september (9), october (10), november (11), december (12)).

parameter.name: ScheduleDaysOfMonth
parameter.description: This parameter represents either a list of the days of the month (1-31) that are applied to the schedule or an asterisk (*) that represents all the elements of the list.

parameter.name: ScheduleDaysOfWeek
parameter.description: This parameter represents either a list of the days of the week that are applied to the schedule or an asterisk (*) that represents all the elements of the list. Each entry in the days of the week list can be a numeric value or the name of the day (sunday (1), monday (2), tuesday (3), wednesday (4), thursday (5), friday (6), saturday (7)).

parameter.name: ScheduleHoursOfDay
parameter.description: This parameter represents either a list of the hours of the day (0-23) that are applied to the schedule or an asterisk (*) that represents all the elements of the list.

parameter.name: ScheduleMinutesOfHour
parameter.description: This parameter represents either a list of the minutes of the hour (0-59) that are applied to the schedule or an asterisk (*) that represents all the elements of the list.

parameter.name: ScheduleSecondsOfMinute
parameter.description: This parameter represents either a list of the minutes of the hour (0-59) that are applied to the schedule or an asterisk (*) that represents all the elements of the list.

parameter.name: EnableScheduleTimezoneOffset
parameter.description: When {{true}}, the value of the {{param|ScheduleTimezoneOffset}} parameter is applied to the schedule elements. When {{false}}, the device's system timezone offset is applied to the schedule elements.

parameter.name: ScheduleTimezoneOffset
parameter.description: The timezone offset, in {{units}}, to be applied to the schedule elements.

object.name: Device.LMAP.Event.{i}.OneOff.
object.description: This object defines a one off timer instance.

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: Date and time, based on {{bibref|RFC3339}}, that the {{object}} instance is to begin operation.

802.1x Authentication provisioning information used for MD5 shared secret exchange. This object will not exist if EAP-MD5 is not a supported authentication type.
802.1x Authentication provisioning information used for TLS certificate authentication. This object will not exist if the EAP-TLS is not a supported authentication type.

This table is REQUIRED to support requesting of option 60 (Vendor Class Identifier), option 61 (Client Identifier) and option 77 (User Class Identifier) values.

profile.name: DSLDiagnostics:1

profile.name: ADSL2Diagnostics:1

profile.name: VDSL2Diagnostics:1

profile.name: MQTTClientBase:1
profile.description: Provides basic MQTT client control and statistics

profile.name: MQTTClientSubscribe:1
profile.description: Adds client subscription control and access to received topics

profile.name: MQTTBrokerBase:1
profile.description: Provides basic MQTT broker control and statistics

profile.name: MQTTBrokerBridgeBase:1
profile.description: Adds parameters for MQTT network interconnection with Bridges

profile.description: This profile implies support for all of the Gateway requirements defined in {{bibref|TR-069|Annex F}}.

profile.name: UDPConnReq:1
profile.description: This profile only applies to Internet Gateway Devices that are acting as CPE behind a NAT gateway as described in {{bibref|TR-069|Annex G}}, and implies support for all of the CPE requirements defined within Annex G.
